title: Assistent Business Analist
description:
Ben jij een analytisch talent met een passie voor data, business intelligence en procesverbetering?

Sluit je aan bij ons team als Assistent Business Analist en bouw mee aan onze toekomst!

Hier vervul je een unieke rol waarbij je zowel de analytische als de strategische verantwoordelijkheid draagt.

**Dit breng je mee**

* HBO afgeronde opleiding in de richting van Bedrijfseconomie, Economie, Finance of een vergelijkbare richting;
* Minimaal 2 Jaar ervaring in een soortgelijke rol;
* Sterke analytische vaardigheden en een scherp oog voor detail;
* Goede communicatieve vaardigheden en een proactieve houding;
* Ervaring met data-analyse tools en -software (Qlik Sense is een pre)
* Teamspeler die ook goed zelfstandig kan werken.

**Dit krijg je van ons**

* Een startsalaris dat past bij de functie en jouw ervaring
* We leggen jouw- en onze ambities vast in een ontwikkelplan en investeren écht in jou: samen groeien!
* 26 vakantiedagen en de mogelijkheid om daar 10 dagen per jaar bij te kopen
* Een goede pensioenopbouw (fijn voor later)
* Gratis fitness (in het pand, dus lekker makkelijk na, of juist voor je werk)
* Een fietsplan (jij staat nooit meer in de file)
* Om de week staat er een zeer goed gevulde groente- en fruitkist voor je klaar (daar wordt heel de familie blij van)

**Dit ga je doen** 

Als Assistent Business Analist speel je een cruciale rol in het signaleren van ontwikkelingen binnen het bedrijf en de markt. Je analyseert commerciële resultaten en processen en voorziet de directie en het commercieel managementteam (MT) van actuele en volledige stuurinformatie. Jouw team speelt een cruciale rol in het waarborgen van de correcte informatievoorziening en jullie dragen bij aan het behalen van onze bedrijfsdoelen. In deze rol werk je nauw samen met diverse afdelingen en draag je bij aan het optimaliseren van bedrijfsprocessen, hierin ben jij proactief en communicatief vaardig, om te realiseren dat alle afdelingen volledig worden geïnformeerd en begeleid bij het doorvoeren van (proces)wijzigingen. In een snelgroeiend team draag jij bij aan de verdere ontwikkeling van bestaande en nieuwe rapportages in onze BI-software (Qlik Sense).

**Enthousiast geworden?**

Ben jij de Assistent Business Analist die wij zoeken en wil je graag bijdragen aan het succes van het mooiste AGF bedrijf van Nederland? Stuur dan je cv en motivatiebrief naar Monia. We kijken uit naar je sollicitatie!

Soort dienstverband: Fulltime

Rooster:

* Dagdienst
* ma-vr

Soorten aanvullende vergoedingen:

* Vakantiegeld

Werklocatie: Fysiek

title: Senior Data Analyst
description:
**Introduction to the job**
---------------------------


If you join the Business Intelligence & Analytics team, you become part of ASML’s largest department: Development & Engineering. Here you will get a front-row seat of our company’s key process: where the sharpest minds in hardware and software, design and develop some of the world’s most complex machines.


Our mission is to work with experts in our organization and use data to create value for ASML and its customers. We do this by participating in large transformation programs that bring change throughout ASML, and by working directly with teams and colleagues in the organization to unlock new insights and develop effective data-driven solutions that solve specific problems and drive continuous improvement. We work closely with our partners in IT to ensure our algorithms, dashboards and applications are deployed in a sustainable manner and supported to secure availability.


With the demand for chips continuously growing, our customers challenge us to deliver more advanced lithography solutions at higher speeds and quality. We consider data a key enabler in facing this challenge and are excited about the impact we can make by leveraging our data, analytics and visualization skills. For example, by predicting the amount of parts to keep in stock, by developing an enterprise dashboard that delivers consistent performance insights on all levels of the organization, or by analyzing unstructured data for opportunities to improve cycle time of specific processes.

**Role and Responsibilities**
-----------------------------

* Talk with experts in our organization to understand the business problems they face. In addition brainstorm with your colleagues to see how data can be used to solve these problems
* Perform exploratory data analysis to identify trends and patterns that can sharpen the challenge and use all tools available and determine the best solution, from descriptive to prescriptive insights
* Get into the ‘dirt’ by cleaning and preparing data for processing, statistical analysis and modelling. Furthermore you will provide quick fact-based answers and insights to ad hoc questions during transformation prototyping
* Transform data to insights by applying different techniques using your craftsmanship. Next to that you will also formulate hypotheses based on business process understanding and test using business process data
* Challenge business assumptions using fact-based analyses and quick prototypes to convince stakeholders
* Directly manage stakeholders of your analysis by involving them on developments in your work. Moreover, use business knowledge and prior experiences to challenge data analysis requests and approaches
* Think outside boundaries of your job description in order to support the quality of your deliverable. And have fun with your colleagues, dare to disrupt, find the best solution and make it ‘stick’

**Education and experience**
----------------------------


Bachelor or Master degree  

At least 4 years of practical experience

 **Skills**

Working at the cutting edge of tech, you’ll always have new challenges and new problems to solve – and working together is the only way to do that. You won’t work in a silo. Instead, you’ll be part of a creative, dynamic work environment where you’ll collaborate with supportive colleagues. There is always space for creative and unique points of view. You’ll have the flexibility and trust to choose how best to tackle tasks and solve problems. To thrive in this job, you’ll need the following skills:

* Fluent in Python and R or SQL
* Knowledge of data cleaning, modelling and transformation
* Fluent in English both verbally and written
* Excellent in math, statistics and data visualization

**Other information**

*This position requires access to controlled technology, as defined in the Export Administration Regulations (15 C.F.R. § 730, et seq.). Qualified candidates must be legally authorized to access such controlled technology prior to beginning work. Business demands may require ASML to proceed with candidates who are immediately eligible to access controlled technology.*


EOE AA M/F/Veteran/Disability

*This position requires access to controlled technology, as defined in the Export Administration Regulations (15 C.F.R. § 730, et seq.). Qualified candidates must be legally authorized to access such controlled technology prior to beginning work. Business demands may require ASML to proceed with candidates who are immediately eligible to access controlled technology.*

**Diversity and inclusion**
---------------------------


ASML is an Equal Opportunity Employer that values and respects the importance of a diverse and inclusive workforce. It is the policy of the company to recruit, hire, train and promote persons in all job titles without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, or gender identity. We recognize that diversity and inclusion is a driving force in the success of our company.


Need to know more about applying for a job at ASML? Read our frequently asked questions.
company_description: ASML provides chipmakers with hardware, software and services to mass produce patterns on silicon, helping to build the electronic devices that keep us informed, entertained and connected.

title: Senior Data Engineer - Big Data
description:
It's fun to work in a company where people truly BELIEVE in what they are doing!*We're committed to bringing passion and customer focus to the business.*
Senior Data Engineer – Big Data with supply chain functional domain project background
Job Description
As a Senior Data Engineer, you will be responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining scalable big data solutions to support the agriculture supply chain operations of our client. Leveraging your extensive experience with Cloudera Hadoop and other big data technologies, you will build robust data pipelines, data warehouses, and analytics platforms that can handle large volumes of structured and unstructured data from across the agriculture supply chain.
Key Responsibilities:* Architect and implement end-to-end big data solutions using the Cloudera Hadoop ecosystem (HDFS, Hive, Impala, Spark, etc.)
* Design and develop efficient data ingestion, transformation, and loading processes to integrate data from various sources across the agriculture supply chain
* Create scalable data storage and processing frameworks to support real-time and batch analytics
* Implement data quality checks, data lineage, and data governance practices to ensure data integrity
* Work closely with data scientists and business analysts to understand requirements and translate them into technical solutions
* Optimize system performance, monitor, and troubleshoot issues in the big data infrastructure
* Mentor and guide junior data engineers on best practices and new technologies
* Document technical designs, processes, and procedures for knowledge sharing and future maintenance


Required Skills and Experience:* 8-12 years of experience as a Data Engineer or Big Data Engineer
* Expertise in designing and implementing Cloudera Hadoop-based data platforms
* Proficient in Python, Scala, or Java for developing data processing pipelines
* Strong understanding of data modeling, ETL, and data warehousing concepts
* Experience with big data technologies such as Spark, Kafka, Hive, Impala, Sqoop, and Flume
* Familiarity with cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP) and containerization technologies (Docker, Kubernetes)
* Hands-on experience in the agriculture or supply chain domain
* Excellent problem-solving, analytical, and communication skills
* Ability to work in a team and mentor junior engineers


Preferred Qualifications:* Master's degree in Computer Science, Data Science, or a related field
* Certifications in Cloudera, Hadoop, or other big data technologies
* Experience in agile software development methodologies


If you like wild growth and working with happy, enthusiastic over-achievers, you'll enjoy your career with us!
Not the right fit? Let us know you're interested in a future opportunity by clicking *Introduce Yourself* in the top-right corner of the page or create an account to set up email alerts as new job postings become available that meet your interest!

title: Data Business Analyst Supply Chain
description:
It's fun to work in a company where people truly BELIEVE in what they are doing!*We're committed to bringing passion and customer focus to the business.*
The Opportunity:
As a Senior Data Business Analyst, you will be responsible for driving data-driven decision making and strategic insights to support the agriculture supply chain operations of our client. Leveraging your extensive experience in the agriculture domain and expertise in sustainability and compliance initiatives, you will work closely with cross-functional teams to identify, analyze, and interpret complex data sets to uncover opportunities for optimization, cost savings, and improved sustainability.
We are seeking a dedicated Supply chain Sustainability & ESG Subject Matter Expert (SME) with a profound understanding of ESG, EUDR and sustainability factors, particularly within Supply Chain. Understand the risks, opportunities, & consult client on data gaps & data sources.
The ideal candidate will possess expertise in compliance requirements for major regulations across the globe relevant to ESG like European Union Deforestation, Extended Producer Responsibility & GHG Emissions Reporting.
Key Responsibilities* Understand the client business requirements/ problem statements with limited information, come up with comprehensive solution approach with necessary assumptions.
* Setup & drive discovery sessions with client team to understand ESG & EUDR digitalization project requirements, As is Process, Success criteria, challenges & bottle necks mapping.
* Collaborate with business stakeholders to understand their data and analytics requirements, and translate them into technical solutions using the Cloudera Hadoop ecosystem
* Perform exploratory data analysis to identify trends, patterns, and insights that drive strategic decision-making in the agriculture supply chain
* Clearly communicate insights and technical approaches to clients verbally and in writing, including documenting analytical methodologies for reports and developing graphs, charts, and other outputs appropriate for use by senior executives.
* Collaborate cross-functionally to integrate supply chain sustainability considerations into business strategies and operations.
* Describe the recording of the source data, including a summary of the person/system that collects and records initial data.
* Describe the aggregation of the source data, including a summary of how information generated from multiple data sources is aggregated to complete a single KPI metric.
* Consult clients on calculations performed on the source data, or to estimate data, including a summary of the processes necessary to transform data into a series of inputs utilized within the final KPI metric calculation and inventory.
* Conceptualise cohesive ESG/EUDR data architecture.
* Develop systematic rules for collecting and processing EUDR raw data.
* Support clients in aligning their reporting practices with international and sector-specific frameworks such as EUDR, CDP, and the SDGs.


Required Qualifications:* 8+ years of experience as a Business Data Analyst or Senior Data Analyst in the sustainable supply chain, ESG domain
* B.Tech, or MBA, Good to have a degree in related discipline preferred such as Climate Change, Sustainability, Business, or Environmental Engineering.
* Strong quantitative and qualitative analytical skills.
* Past exposure to CPG, Agro-based Industry or related will be an advantage.
* Exposure to working on ERP systems viz, SAP ECC, TMS, IBP, etc.
* Strong understanding of data modeling, ETL, SQL and data warehousing concepts
* Proficient in Python, SQL, and data visualization tools (Tableau, Power BI, etc.)
* Familiarity with EUDR, EPR, GRI, SASB, and other market standards and guidelines.
* Experience managing and coaching individuals/teams.
* Strong work ethic and eagerness to learn in a constantly evolving and fast-paced environment.
* A genuine team player who can reach objectives individually, as well as through close collaboration and coordination with other team members.


If you like wild growth and working with happy, enthusiastic over-achievers, you'll enjoy your career with us!
Not the right fit? Let us know you're interested in a future opportunity by clicking *Introduce Yourself* in the top-right corner of the page or create an account to set up email alerts as new job postings become available that meet your interest!

title: Commercial Analyst and Marketing Support
description:
Eindhoven, Netherlands
Category
 Sales
Posted Date
 07/05/2024
Job Id
 351751
  
We’re looking for a Commercial Analyst to join our BrightSites Team in Eindhoven or Amsterdam.


Working for Signify means being creative and adaptive. Our culture of continuous learning and commitment to diversity and inclusion creates an environment that allows you to build your skills and career. Together, we’re transforming our industry.


As the world leader in lighting, we’re constantly ahead of the curve. Through our leadership in connected lighting and the Internet of Things, we’re breaking new grounds in data analytics, AI, and smart homes, offices, cities and more!


Signify is one of the few companies in the world to achieve carbon neutrality and our next sustainability goals are even bolder: doubling our positive impact on the environment and society by 2025.


As a **Commercial Analyst,** you’ll be responsible for analyzing and sizing a new market we are entering as a company, understanding and sharing market trends and insights, screening the competitive landscape. Additionally you will be supporting all kinds of marketing related topics around awareness and promotions of this business unit.


We’re on the lookout for forward-thinking innovators with a passion for sustainability. If you match this description, get in touch!

**What you’ll do**
------------------

* Analyze and size a new addressable market for Signify
* Lead competitor analytics and reporting
* Screen and understand market trends and insights, provide marketing support with generative AI.
* Build business cases in close collaboration with Key Account Managers in Europe and North America
* Coordinate all marketing related activities such as press releases, social media promotions, event based activities

**Your qualifications**
-----------------------

* 1-2 years of experience in a similar role working with data driven insights/solutions
* Analytical skills
* Creative content adaptation and creation
* Digital marketing knowledge
* Agile mindset and passion for results

**What you’ll get in return…**
------------------------------


You will be working in a dynamic and fast moving environment, surrounded by passionate and motivated team members who all contribute to make this young business unit, which has a huge growth potential, grow fast. The learning potential about what lighting can do beyond illumination in this role is granted.


We’re offering multiple opportunities for career development, like mentoring, coaching and stretch assignments, with strong international exposure for dynamic profiles. Learning is fundamental to our culture. Through continuous learning, we are transforming the industry. You have the chance to learn every day, acquire new skills and perspectives through customized online programs, and on-the-job experiences.


See #SignifyLife through the eyes of our employees!

title: Docent Visualisatie
description:
**Docent Visualisatie**



Standplaats ’s-Hertogenbosch



De taakomvang 0,8 - 1,0 fte.



HAS green academy is een hogeschool en kennisinstelling voor agro, food en leefomgeving in Den Bosch en Venlo. Aan de HAS studeren ongeveer 3.300 voltijdstudenten aan 18 hbo-opleidingen waarvan twee internationaal. De studenten werken vanaf dag één samen met medestudenten aan actuele vraagstukken van bedrijven en organisaties. HAS green academy leidt hen op tot ondernemende professionals met een open mind.



Naast de voltijdstudenten volgen jaarlijks ruim 500 professionals bij HAS green academy verschillende bedrijfsopleidingen en incompany trainingen. Daarnaast zet de HAS haar kennis en ervaring in voor onderzoek, advies en productontwikkeling. De HAS is daarmee voor organisaties, bedrijven en overheden een partner in het verkennen, verbinden en toepassen van ‘groene’ kennis en kunde.



Aan de HAS zijn 550 medewerkers verbonden. Dertien lectoren en zo’n 50 docentonderzoekers werken samen met studenten, docenten en professionals uit het werkveld aan praktijkgerichte onderzoeksprogramma’s, zowel in Nederland als daarbuiten. HAS green academy draagt hiermee bij aan praktische oplossingen voor een gezonde omgeving met voldoende gezond voedsel.



Om als kennisinstelling blijvend bij te dragen aan een toekomst met genoeg gezond voedsel in een gezonde leefomgeving verkent HAS green academy in de strategie voor de komende jaren waar haar grootste toegevoegde waarde ligt. De HAS wil weloverwogen kunnen bepalen hoe ze zowel HAS-breed als per kennisdomein in de komende jaren de grootst mogelijke toegevoegde waarde kan leveren. Ze is trots op de bijdrage aan innovatieve voedselproductie, bloeiende ondernemingen en versterking van ecosystemen.


**Cluster Leefomgeving en Natuur**



Je valt onder het Cluster Leefomgeving en Natuur en maakt deel uit van de opleiding Applied Geo-Information Science (AGIS) in ’s-Hertogenbosch. Het team AGIS bestaat uit 20 enthousiaste collega’s.



We leiden op tot geo-informatieprofessionals die ruimtelijke data analyseren, omzetten naar informatie en deze voor gebruikers geschikt te maken in toepassingen. We doen dit m.b.v. ICT, big data, artificial intelligence en visualisatietechnieken en ontwikkelen zo toepassingen zoals apps, interactieve kaarten, infographics en dashboards. Een geo-informatieprofessional kan gaan werken als data-analyst, graphic designer, GIS expert, consultant of user experience ontwerper bij bedrijven als NOS, RIVM, provincies of ingenieursbureaus. Nationale en internationale vraagstukken waarmee hij/zij zich bezig houdt, zijn klimaatverandering, verstedelijking, wateroverlast en biodiversiteit en altijd met het oog op locatie.


**Inhoud van de functie**


* Het verzorgen en ontwikkelen van onderwijs op het gebied van cartografie, datavisualisatie en storytelling met kaarten
* Bijdragen aan doorontwikkeling van een standaardkwaliteit rond cartografisch werk en datavisualisaties in de opleiding AGIS
* Bijdragen aan de samenhang tussen cartografie en werken met geodata in (open source) GIS-tools en visualisatie software
* Het mee opzetten en uitvoeren van cursussen en adviestrajecten voor het bedrijfsleven.
* Het onderzoeken en inbedden van belangrijke trends en ontwikkelingen met name in 3D, AI, en tooling
* Het verbinden van onderwijs en onderzoek met de geo-sector (of geo-werkveld)
* Het begeleiden van projectgroepen, afstudeeropdrachten, stages en het coachen van studenten.


**Wij zoeken**


* Je hebt ervaring als docent en/of adviseur, met minimaal een afgeronde opleiding op HBO-niveau.
* Je kunt vraagstukken, waar de geo-sector tegenaan loopt, vertalen naar praktische oplossingen.
* Jij denkt in oplossingen en innovaties en hebt een duidelijk praktisch profiel.
* Je hebt minimaal 3 jaar werkervaring in ruimtelijke data visualisatie en applicatie-ontwerp.
* Je houdt van uitdaging: jij vindt het leuk om bij te dragen in het integraal werkende team van de opleiding AGIS.
* Je vindt het leuk om een coördinerende rol op te pakken.
* Het werken met en in een team vind je belangrijk en je pakt daarin een constructieve, eerlijke en collegiale rol.
* Je wil een bijdrage leveren aan de (inhoudelijke) doorontwikkeling van het onderwijs.
* Ervaring met Qgis en/of de ESRI-suite en de Adobe-suite is een pré.


**Wat bieden we jou**


* Een inspirerende werkomgeving waar jij jouw steentje kan bijdragen aan het verbeteren van de toekomst van de wereld en onze sector;
* Een maandsalaris van minimaal € 4.234,28 tot maximaal € 5.936,77 bruto bij een fulltime aanstelling (schaal 11 cao hbo 2023-2024);
* Je wordt benoemd in de generieke functiereeks Onderwijs, onderzoek en zakelijke dienstverlening B;
* De aanstelling is in eerste instantie voor een jaar. Daarna behoort, bij gebleken geschiktheid en formatieruimte, een verlenging en eventuele vaste aanstelling tot de mogelijkheden.
* Een eindejaarsuitkering die ongeveer gelijk is aan een extra maandsalaris (8,3%);
* 8% vakantiegeld;
* Ongeveer 50 verlofdagen afhankelijk van het aantal uren dat je per week werkt;
* Een goede pensioenregeling, collectieve zorgverzekering, mogelijkheid tot (betaald) ouderschapsverlof, collectieve arbeidsongeschiktheidsverzekering voor gedeeltelijke arbeidsongeschiktheid, pensioenregeling via ABP en een maandelijkse bijdrage aan je zorgverzekering.
* Tevens bieden wij startende docenten een uitstekend begeleidingstraject aan, met name voor kandidaten zonder specifieke onderwijservaring en/of onderwijskundige opleiding.


**Ben je enthousiast geworden?**

Laat dan **uiterlijk 18 augustus** je sollicitatie achter op onze website www.HAS.nl/werkenbij. De eerste gesprekken vinden plaats op 5 september 2024, de tweede gesprekken op 18 september 2024. De beoogde startdatum voor deze functie is 15 november 2024.  

Heb je nog vragen? Neem dan contact op met Vincent Wissink, portefeuillehouder onderwijs, via Vincent.wissink@has.nl of 06-24 41 00 69.



De HAS voert standaard een referentiecheck uit na het tweede selecterend sollicitatiegesprek.



De vacature wordt zowel in- als extern uitgezet. Bij gelijke geschiktheid genieten interne kandidaten de voorkeur.


*Acquisitie door derden wordt niet op prijs gesteld.*

title: Business Analyst Analytics
description:
A
Posted by
Alexander Mungkorn
Recruiter


For a client based in Amsterdam, we are looking for a Business Analyst in Analytics to join the Benelux business insights team. Focused on the marketing, segment you engage with senior leadership and work across teams with marketeers, financial analysts, business and product developers to drive strategy and business planning. Based on data analysis, you deliver insights to your stakeholders.


| Responsibilities |


* Analyze data to get insights on trends, anomalies and opportunities and drive business decisions


* Drive marketing campaigns both in set up (strategy, selections, experimentation design) and evaluation.


* Gather market insights and translate them into impactful initiatives for our business teams


* Set-up, automate, maintain, and own dashboards and reporting structure for operational metrics and revenue streams of your focus area


* Use advanced modeling to gain understanding of the drivers of customer behavior


* Closely work together with the marketing teams and finance teams to define the key operational and financial metrics


* Construct and deliver clear, concise presentations of findings, key product and user performance metrics and management recommendations both in oral and written form


| Requirements |


Academic degree, preferably in a quantitative field like mathematics, econometrics, statistics etc.


* Very strong analytical, reporting and visualization skills


* Advanced SQL and Excel skills are a requirement. Experience with R, Python or similar is a plus


* Proven experience in working with large, multisource data sets and usage of analytics to drive business and product decisions and strategy


* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills; proven ability to successfully work and partner across multiple functions in an organization


* The skill to explain complicated analyses in a simple way to colleagues and management


* Experienced in Marketing Analytics


* Ability to work in an agile and flexible environment where change is part of the day-to-day environment


* The attitude to go that extra mile when needed and celebrate success after achievements

  



| Job Details |


Start Date: ASAP


Full Time: 32-40 hours/week


Duration: 1 Year


Location: Amsterdam (Hybrid)


For inquiries, contact Alexander Mungkorn, Delivery Consultant, at alexander.mungkorn@mbanl.com.

title: Growth Product Manager
description:
**Help us bring people and businesses together**
Our SaaS platform enables multi-location brands and businesses to boost their online presence. From big to small, from Adidas to ZenPark, our client base contains some of your favourite brands as well, we bet. **The Past, Present & Future** **The Past:** Uberall was founded in 2013 by David Federhen and Florian Hübner, two longtime friends with a vision to improve customer experience across the online and offline worlds. They created a platform that connected companies with local customers in the digital-first moment. **The Present:** We're on a mission **to empower businesses to thrive locally**, and believe every business deserves success, regardless of size or location. Simply put, our location marketing platform exists to help our customers get found online and connect with customers through search, discovery, engagement, and conversion. **The Future:** We're a growing company with a bright future, and our journey to become the global leader in location marketing is well underway. We have a passionate and diverse team, a comprehensive, intuitive platform, and a clear vision for the future. We're looking for talented and passionate people (like you \uD83D\uDC4B) to join us on our journey.  

  

**You and us**  

We are approaching 400 Uberallers, with 50+ different nationalities, who live and breathe our three core values:  

\uD83C\uDF35 GROW TOGETHER* DEMONSTRATE PASSION & PERFORMANCE


✊ BE BOLD & DRIVE CHANGE  

So, what are you waiting for? If you're passionate, driven, and ready to be bold, we want you on our team! Apply now and let's grow together.\uD83D\uDE80  

We are looking for an exceptional **Growth Product Manager** to join our growing product management organisation and help form our Product Growth function internally. This role will focus on **Activation** and **Monetization** to begin with, while consulting other Product Managers across the organization on improving overall **Product Adoption**. The team’s mission is to ensure that our prospects, customers and partners acquire, activate and continuously experience the value of our products.  

You will be contributing to the overall product strategy alongside your Design and Engineering counterparts, and you will specifically be responsible for translating Uberall’s overarching value proposition into actionable insights and smart recommendations across several user touchpoints.
Take
### **Your Responsibilities:**

* Take full ownership of the Activation & Monetization product roadmaps at Uberall - from leading the overall strategy and vision to creating and iterating on an outcome-driven roadmap to delivering value to customers and reselling partners.
* Lead the discovery effort leveraging data, internal feedback collection, regular customer interviews, research, technical requirements, etc. to understand the needs of our personae & find the most suitable solutions. Champion continuous discovery habits throughout the product organisation.
* Leverage the best research methods in collaboration with Product Design and Data Analyst to identify user pain points (product data analysis, user testing, etc.)
* You will be responsible for the appropriate planning, prioritisation, and release management processes with your Engineering counterpart to enable us to launch new features rapidly.
* Drive a test and iterate approach that focuses on experimentation to validate ideas before building software.
* Implement tactics to maximise the adoption of your features and their business impact.
* Partner with Uberall’s marketing, sales, support and success teams to coordinate the go-to-market strategy and ensure high impact of releases.
* Communicate frequently and clearly to internal stakeholders and customers/partners.
* Define, report and optimise product goals and KPIs to improve your product area.
* Contribute to and improve our product practices with your expertise, knowledge, learnings from past experiences, books, podcasts, communities, etc.

### **Your Profile:**

* 3+ years working in the product management area of a fast-growing tech startup (SaaS).
* You built at least 1 product that reached at least 100k something (users, bookings, monthly revenues, anything)
* Ownership mentality and entrepreneurial approach to building products
* Ability to couple your business sense with data (using Pendo, Heap, and SQL)
* Work with Product Analysts to derive how to increase LTV and reduce Churn via proper ActivationHistory of leading product discovery, solving meaningful customer and business problems, and delivering scalable solutions
* Experience in crafting great, simple user experiences in complex, data-rich customer-facing products
* Solid analytical thinking - you can evaluate sets of data, identify opportunities, and draw insights to incorporate in your product and demonstrate value to your customers
* Outstanding communicator - your message to both internal and external stakeholders is crisp, clear and to the point.
* You can convey a narrative that creates clarity out of ambiguity, articulates well-conceived goals, and builds consensus amongst your peers and partners.
* Passion for product and interest in product-led growth strategies Strong interest in Uberall and the problem we are solving

**What we offer:**  

\uD83D\uDC9C **A mission with meaning and purpose** At Uberall, we foster genuine connections between local businesses and people. Our diverse team allows us to win together with our partners, co-workers, and customers. Speaking of our customers, they’re some of the most recognizable businesses in the world.  

\uD83D\uDE01 **A truly human culture** We’re famous for our culture. Uberallers live by our values of mutual respect and boldness. We’re open, collaborative risk-takers with a whole lot of passion and grit.  

\uD83E\uDD38\uD83C\uDFFD‍ ️ **Flexibility** **to** **fit** **your** **lifestyle** Want to come to an office for collaboration? We’ve got space for you in Berlin, Amsterdam, Barcelona, Detroit, and London. We also offer co-working access in Montreal, Paris, LA and San Diego. Prefer to work remotely? Fine by us! Bonus points if we meet your pets in a video call. If working from another country is legally possible for you and within a reasonable time zone, we happily support work-ations.  

\uD83D\uDCB8 **A piece of the pie** Our pay & perks are competitive, and you better believe we review them on the regular to make sure they stay that way. We grow together, so of course all Uberallers are part of our long-term incentive program through VSOP/ESOP.* **Emotional and intellectual connection** Events and alignment sessions - YES and YES. With the team, cross-functions, regional, you name it - we love bringing people together. Uberallers share a LOT of hobbies. Whatever you’re into – reading books, baking, heavy metal, fostering kittens . . . you’ll find kindred spirits on our team.

  

\uD83E\uDDD8 **Health and Wellness** We prioritize your wellness with generous holiday time, paid parental and circumstantial leave, and individualized health and wellness opportunities depending on your location.* ️ **All-access pass** Get immersed in Uberall from day one. Your onboarding is packed with a deep dive into our values, insights into all our departments, and a chance to ask the CEO anything. We come together monthly for our town hall and product showroom so you’re always in the know.

  

\uD83C\uDF35 **Everyday growth** We support you on your non-stop learning journey. We offer development dialogues, live workshops on topics like resilience and feedback, and a Leadership Academy to make sure our leaders have all the tools to bring out the very best in teams. We also invest in your growth with a learning grant program reinforcing our commitment to fostering a culture of continuous learning.  

\uD83D\uDDA5 **Top-of-the-line** **tech** MacBook Pro, magic mouse, 2nd screen . . . Need anything else? Let the People & Culture team know.  

Remember our "**Grow Together**" value from the beginning of the ad? **We mean it.**  

\uD83C\uDF35\uD83C\uDFD4✊  

Everything starts with getting in touch. The best way to express your interest is by applying online. We will be carefully reading your profile and can't wait to hear from you.  

In the meantime, let our "life@uberall" social accounts give you some real-life impressions.  

\uD83D\uDC65 **Diversity, Equity, Inclusion & Belonging:**  

At Uberall, we believe inclusion unlocks the potential of diversity. It’s right there in our number one core value – Grow Together. Sure, we’re approaching 400 unique people with over 50 nationalities working in 30 different countries, but we’re all Uberallers. That means we’re collaborative, open-minded, and assume positive intent in everything we do. We don’t judge, and we don’t exclude.  

Our flexible ways of working are designed to make sure each and every Uberaller belongs and thrives, no matter their background, abilities, or lifestyle. We don’t just think inclusion makes us stronger, we KNOW it.
