title: Machine Learning Engineer Future Model Landscape
description:
**Machine Learning Engineer Future Model Landscape**  

As a Machine Learning Engineer, you will be the linking pin between the business and IT development. You optimize the (ML) Model workflow in DLL, development and deployment, with a platform approach. We are looking at automating the entire Model Lifecycle as much as possible. That we intend to set up self service onboarding of new models, where the intention is to have the least amount of IT involvement as possible. Also, we need to provide a stable platform, which can serve models in a secure/regulatory compliant way. You will work closely with Data Management and departments like Group Analytics, and Risk. The platforms are the Model Lifecycle and Model Execution Platforms.



Find out more here about how you can unleash your full potential at DLL

 **Day to day:**  

* Gathering business and functional data requirements
* Be a sparring partner for product owners and other stakeholders
* Create solution designs and data models, with your team and in alignment with architectural guidelines
* Create designs and ensure solutions are built according to the designs and guidelines.
* As a team player help out where needed to get the job done
* Create User Stories in close alignment with team and stakeholders
* Embedding IT requirements, security, compliance and non-functional requirements – and taking into account architecture landscape and target state.
* Be involved in System Test and UAT, check whether built solution fulfills acceptance criteria from a technical perspective
* Organize test activities/ events and follow-up on findings, following DLL policy regarding testing
* Ensures that deliveries by the team is supported with proper documentation


**All members enjoy**

* Two working days per year volunteering for a local charity
* Health and Wellness program including healthy food, free health checks, fun health & vitality activities
* Flexible hours with possibility to work from home
* Career development opportunities: online learning, member development programs
* Click this link for an overview of all the benefits in your region.


“We lead the way in meeting the need for flexibility and transparency which our customers increasingly expect”

 **Essentials:**  

* Is passionate about data and data processing
* We are not looking for a Data Scientist or a Data Engineer, the position is related to the ML Ops part of the model lifecycle.
* 3+ years of hands-on experience designing and implementing Azure-based systems. Experience with Azure, Databricks, CI/CD, MLOps, Automation.
* 3+ years of hand-on experience with software development using (preferably) Python or other programming language
* Understand/knows relevant business processes related with Banking and Risk/Modeling or can learn them quickly.
* Has experience in talking to business users to gather requirements for setting up the appropriate DevOps pipelines. Can ask 5x why.
* Can switch from details to the bigger picture and back. Can always look at requirements/wishes as part of the bigger picture.
* Can explain requirements to developers (via User stories), has experience working within Azure DEVOPS
* Can work in an environment where a day never will be as planned. Is flexible in these situations, but also able to push back where needed.
* Can facilitate workshops with business to define process, requirements, and impact on current way of working.
* Can set priorities or challenge priorities.
* Has a can-do mentality, (no 9-5 mentality)
* Speaks/writes English fluently.


**Extras:**


* Growth Mindset
* Self-starter and can work independently.
* Team player, together we get it done

  

**Choose wellbeing**  

DLL’s wellbeing ambition is to educate, equip and empower members to build connections, manage their mental, emotional, physical and financial wellness and maintain balance between work and the other priorities that make up their lives.



Our four wellbeing categories are as follows:


* Connection – Build meaningful connections with other DLL members
* Health – Manage mental, emotional and physical health
* Finance – Provide learning opportunities to help members achieve personal financial health
* Lifestyle – Maintain balance between work and life priorities


These are the things that matter to our members and the wellbeing of our members matters to DLL

 **Settling in**  

At DLL, we are many things. We are team members, family members, community member. We are members of society, members of different cultures and nationalities. Members of change. We each have different beliefs, different passions, different viewpoints, talents and interests. We come from different backgrounds, cultures, nationalities and histories.



But for all of our differences, we share one thing in common: each of us are members of DLL.



Our company was founded in the Netherlands. But today we are truly a multinational business. Our unique culture is rooted in higher collaboration, less hierarchy and an honest directness that enable us to integrate, ideate and innovate across country lines.



Many companies say they are European, American, Asian or Australian, at DLL we are all these places and more.



We are a cross-culture collaborative – an interconnected network – that comes together every single day with one goal in mind: **Partnering for a better world.**

 **Good to know:**  

* Deadline for application: July 21st (Due to high volume of applications this requisition may close prior to posted close date)
* The selection process may involve an assessment
* Applications via email will not be reviewed. Please apply online via our career website
* DLL’s referral program applies
* #LI-NA1
* #LI-HYBRID
* For more information, please contact our Talent acquisition partner Natascha Hooi via natascha.hooi@dllgroup.com.


DLL appreciates the time you spend applying to our openings. We advise only those who qualify for an interview will be contacted. Hiring subject to successful completion of a background check.



DLL is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to inclusive, barrier-free recruitment and selection processes and work environments. If contacted for an employment opportunity, please advise Human Resources if you require accommodation in accordance with our values and all applicable legislation.

title: Technical Supplier Manager D&E Machine Conditioning
description:
**Introduction to the job**
---------------------------


ASML supports the semiconductor industry’s ongoing quest for producing faster, smarter and more energy efficient chips. ASML creates lithographic systems that the semiconductor industry needs to achieve these goals. Our success as a company depends on strong cooperation between ASML and our suppliers.


Are you experienced in proactively managing suppliers? Do you understand product design of high-tech machinery? Would you like to help develop the supplier to be ready to engage with the industrialization of our future products? Do you like to take ownership to ensure suppliers deliver the right quality on time? Would you like to further develop your result driven approach and your excellent stakeholder management skills? Do you have experience with Lean Six Sigma and Statistical Process Control (SPC)? If so, we are looking for you!

**Mission**


The Technical Supplier Manager (TSM) is a member of ASML Supplier Account team who is responsible for developing and maintaining the technology at ASML suppliers while maintaining the strategic management level relationship to enable an optimal engineering collaboration, and NPI execution.

  

In addition to being the technical interface between supplier, ASML D&E and S&P, the TSM will collaborate on complex technical issues, driving technical process improvements and responsible for developing the capabilities at the supplier to develop and industrialize the applicable ASML products with a well-defined and organized project organization.


TSM can be a member of the Category team where category strategies are developed and supplier selections are done. You’ll play a key role in technical capabilities knowhow within the supply base during the supplier selection process.


As a member of the ASML Supplier Account Team (SAT) you work closely together with the Account Lead (AL) the Logistics Supplier Manager (LSM), Supplier Account Lead (SAL) and Quality Supplier Manager (QSM). TSM contributes to encourage a first-time right and zero repeat technical mindset at suppliers, facilitate accelerated learning (e.g. drive early supplier involvement in the concept design phase of an NPI project), perform process optimization and develop the supplier to a higher maturity level.

**Role and responsibilities**
-----------------------------


The TSM ensures smooth NPI performance on suppliers side and enables ASML D&E to perform and execute ASML Product Generation Process. The TSM works on de-risking the ASML product roadmap by developing technical capabilities in supplier landscape in time, responsible for optimizing the effectiveness and efficiency of executing the supplier’s portfolio. As a TSM you contribute to QLTCS improvements on NPI projects and part quality from technology and quality point of view.


Using your technical knowledge, analytic thinking, professional network and excellent people skills, you are a member of the Supplier Account Team to manage the capability of the supplier according to the agreed Supplier Profile on Technology. The main activities for a TSM are:

* Responsible for the technology section within the Supplier Account Team (SAT)
	+ Driving the technology roadmap in the supplier base
		- Identify the technical capabilities of the supplier
		- Advise to suppliers on strategic level of the technical capabilities
		- Drive improvement projects in technical capabilities
	+ Keep technical supplier capability overview up-to-date
	+ Own the T section of the Supplier Profile Audit in the guidance of lead auditor
	+ Define, monitor and enhance continuous Improvement Plans together with supplier which involve improving the technical capability of supplier as a result of Supplier Profile Audits
	+ Own and drive for T performance
	+ Contribute in defining and executing the overall supply chain strategy
	+ Monitoring the NPI projects to proactively secure operational execution
	+ Participate in new supplier scouting and drive new supplier onboarding
		- Support in preparation of supplier selection proposals
		- Ensure alignment and definition of one Way of Working with the supplier in case of multiple NPI projects
	+ Take part in decision making of new supplier selection.
* Align and mature supplier’s NPI process with ASML PGP process
* Liaison between supplier, D&E and S&P through active participation in SAT by driving technical roadmaps for its suppliers.
	+ Operational guidance and alignment of Supplier Quality Engineers

**Education and experience**
----------------------------


BSc / MSc / PhD degree in Engineering (electrical, mechanical, chemical, optical, industrial), Mathematics or Physics.

* 5-10 years relevant work experience
* Green or Black Belt + Lean Six Sigma experience including tooling (e.g. SPC, FMEA, 8D, MSA) is a plus
* Experience in project & product management in complex high-tech low volume industry
* Experienced in supplier management & related production processes
* Experience in quality improvement & operational excellence in manufacturing environment
* Experience in participating in improvement projects and audits across the supply chain

**Personal skills**
-------------------

* Team player
* Process oriented
* Excellent communication skills
* Pro-active attitude, drive for improvement
* Strong networking and negotiating skills
* Strong analytical skills
* Ability to initiate, influence and steer without formal authority
* Ability to switch between complex matters and high-level conclusions
* Flexible, result driven and committed

**Other information**
---------------------


Within ASML, D&E is responsible for the planning, development, and delivery of integrated solutions that meet business requirements. This responsibility also includes the specification and trade-offs across sectors. Supplier Quality Engineering (SQE), a group within Machine Conditioning (MC) cluster, enables the MC cluster to meet industrialization requirements at suppliers, deliver excellent solutions related to flow and thermal domain towards good product quality.


In today’s complex multi-tier supply chains, this is only possible by creating full transparency in the chains and flexibility at suppliers. The SQE group is involved in over 60 suppliers, on top of that sometimes several tiers deep. For this position international travelling is required, up to 30% depending on the performance of the supplier.


The TSM role is positioned in the Supplier Quality Engineering group in D&E Machine Conditioning. The TSM interfaces with suppliers, design engineers, development project leads, function owners and department managers, supplier network managers, account leads, category manager, customer support, manufacturing.

**Diversity and inclusion**
---------------------------


ASML is an Equal Opportunity Employer that values and respects the importance of a diverse and inclusive workforce. It is the policy of the company to recruit, hire, train and promote persons in all job titles without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, or gender identity. We recognize that diversity and inclusion is a driving force in the success of our company.


Need to know more about applying for a job at ASML? Read our frequently asked questions.

title: Mechanical Engineer
description:
*Do you want to add value to our products by developing and engineering units and components in a multidisciplinary environment? We are always interested to get in touch with talented Mechanical engineers!*  


**Questions about this job?**
Stephanie Vermeulen, Corporate Recruiter
M+31 629693193 or E: stephanie.vermeulen@cpp.canon  


**Mechanical Engineer**
**32-40 hours per week, hybrid in Venlo (NL)**  


**What will be your job like as Mechanical Engineer?**
In our product development projects at R&D you are responsible and focusing on mechanical topics like mediahandling systems, high precision frames, linear and rotational drive systems, printheads, ink fixation units, and more.  

  

Together with the stakeholders (Manufacturing, Service, Purchasing, Quality Assurance) you specify and agree on requirements based on project demands. This is your input together with the designers and architects to come up with technical designs and concepts that meet these objectives, properly balancing time, quality, functionality, and costs (QFTC).  

  

Within the project you collaborate with colleagues from other disciplines. You review your ideas and jointly develop smart creative solutions that meet the overall project objectives. You test and review your model based design(s) by building prototypes to proof the feasibility of the routes you have identified.  


In this role there are plenty of opportunities to further develop yourself, e.g. to lead mechanical engineer, mechanical designer, etc.  


**Responsibilities:**
* Designing mechanical components and units in NX CAD/CAE
* Specify, realize and verify the mechanical design requirements
* Units and parts documentation (Drawings, Instructions, Requirements, etc.)
* Tolerance decompositions in units
* Reviews with vendors
* Perform effectively in a multi-disciplinary team

  


**Furthermore you meet the following criteria:**
* Bachelor degree in mechanical engineering or similar
* Skilled in parametric CAD/CAE systems, Siemens NX
* Eye for detail and excellent problem solving skills
* Knowledge of design principles for precision mechanisms
* Knowledge about manufacturing technologies such as; machining, sheetmetal and plastics
* Team player, hands on, practical, analytic and goal oriented
* Fluent in English, verbal and written. Profound knowledge of Dutch is a plus
* Living nearby Venlo

  


**What can we offer?**
We offer you a job in an open and creative environment within an international organization, where you work with other designers and developers on usability and interaction for products and devices. Your contribution is essential for building an appealing user experience and you work on a variety of projects within product development.  


**And there is more….**
Besides a challenging working environment, scope for personal and professional development you will receive an interesting package of employment conditions:
* a competitive salary, depending on your experience and educational background (€3100,- - €5100,-)
* 38 vacation days
* commuting allowance, standard end-of-year bonus (8,6%), and vacation pay (8%)
* hybrid working for a healthy work-life balance
* a laptop and smartphone
* possibilities to update and grow your knowledge and skills by following trainings, conferences and peer consultation

title: Technical Solution Lead - AI Acceleration Team
description:
**De energietransitie is onmogelijk zonder jou als Technical Solution Lead**


Als Technical Solution Lead bij Alliander ben je cruciaal in het sturen van de technische strategie en visie binnen het AI-domein. Je bent hoofdverantwoordelijk voor het ontwikkelen en in stand houden van een platform voor AI-toepassingen met een team van cloud MLOps engineers.


Je adviseert stakeholders over innovatieve technologieën, zorgt voor de integratie van deze technologieën in onze oplossingsarchitectuur, en bevordert de samenwerking met leveranciers. Door actief ontwikkelingen te volgen en kansen voor optimalisatie te signaleren, draag je bij aan voortdurende verbeteringen en kennisdeling. Als aanspreekpunt voor Product Owner, zowel inhoudelijk als technisch, waarborg je de kwaliteit en toekomstbestendigheid van onze technische oplossingen.


Het energienet van de toekomst maken we voor iedereen, mét iedereen. En als Technical Solution Lead werk jij hieraan mee. Zo ben jij bezig met het:

* Ontwikkelen van functionele en technische ontwerpen die voldoen aan architecturale richtlijnen.
* Zorgen dat de technische implementatie naadloos aansluit op de afnemende teams.
* Bewaken van technische kwaliteit en kennisniveaus van applicaties, en adviseren van Product Owners over technisch lifecycle management.
* Coördineren van probleemoplossing op een gestructureerde manier
* Het vakinhoudelijk coachen van teamleden en stimuleren van innovatie binnen het team.
* Identificeren en implementeren van verbetermogelijkheden in processen en technologieën

**Jij maakt het net completer bij Alliander**


Wist je dat we bij Alliander uit verschillende bedrijven bestaan? Samen met Liander, Qirion, Qterra, Dep, Firan en Entrnce ontwikkelen én beheren we het energienet voor miljoenen inwoners van Nederland. En met de huidige energietransitie is dat hard werken. Dat doen we met de hulp van ruim 8.000 vakmensen. Dankzij deze talenten hebben wij het volste vertrouwen in de energietoekomst van Nederland. Samen met jou maken wij dat mogelijk.


En jij gaat dat doen bij ons bedrijfsonderdeel Alliander.


Dit kan alleen als jij genoeg energie hebt. En de juiste werkomgeving geeft jou dat:

**Het AI Acceleration Team**


Het team waarin je komt te werken, heeft als doel om Alliander te laten versnellen op het gebied van AI. Het is een devops team met Product Owner, Scrummaster, Techlead en MLOps engineers.


Onze afnemers zijn divers: voornamelijk data science teams die interne applicaties ontwikkelen, digitaliseringsteams, analyseteams en enkele business teams. Wij versnellen hen op de volgende thema's:

* Snel en gecontroleerd modellen ontwikkelen op AWS (MLOps voor data science teams) met behulp van Sagemaker en custom images.
* Inzicht en controle bieden door middel van AI-governance tooling, zoals Explainable AI en AI Act.
* Snelle autonome executie door AI-agents met behulp van knowledge bases en vector stores.
* Vergroting van AI-vaardigheden van medewerkers door kennisdeling via Open Space, templates en best practices.
* Operations (beheer, support en continue verbetering van de MLOps-tools en diensten die wij bieden) met security monitoring, geautomatiseerde tests en logging.


Het AI Acceleration team is een platformteam en de engineers trainen dus zelf geen modellen, maar ondersteunen andere teams hierin. Het Team biedt een gestandaardiseerde en geconfigureerde omgeving met tooling voor data analytics, MLOps en access tot data aan. Ook maakt het bouwblokken die de toepassing van LLMs op Alliander data vergemakkelijken zodat de opgeslagen kennis optimaal gebruikt kan worden. Hiermee werken we aan realtime AI-driven decision making.

**Jij maakt het net energieker**


Werken met de nieuwste technieken en innovaties. Dat doe je vanuit je eigen kracht en talent. En dat doe je bij ons. Draag jij daaraan bij met jouw wens om te innoveren?


Met jouw drive excelleer je als Technical Solution Lead. Agile werken en effectief oplossen zijn jouw tweede natuur. Samenwerking en duidelijke communicatie vormen de basis van jouw werkwijze.


Je versterkt ons team met:

* HBO+/WO-werk en denkniveau en bij voorkeur een IT gerelateerde studie gevolgd.
* Minimaal 8 jaar relevante werkervaring
* Technische IT kennis op expertniveau met betrekking tot een aandachtsgebied.
* Ervaring met en kennis van industrialisatie en operationalisering van voorspelmodellen
* Ervaring met het mede opzetten van IT solution architecturen en de implementatie hiervan.
* Vertaalt functionele requirements naar technische requirements
* Ervaring met AWS / CDK / Python / typescript / CI/CD / Docker / Generative AI
* Sparringspartner voor het development team en weet samen met het team breed-gedragen oplossingen te formuleren en kan omgaan met uiteenlopende invalshoeken van developers en weet hun diversiteit in kracht om te zetten

**Voor jou net beter geregeld**


Daarvoor krijg jij op basis van een 38-urige werkweek:

* een salaris van € 5.890,07 tot € 8.414,39 bruto per maand (schaal 11).
* Jaarlijks bovenop je salaris, een individueel keuze budget (IKB) van 18% (fulltime) of 12,8% (parttime) van je bruto jaarsalaris. Dit is inclusief 8% vakantietoeslag. Je kunt dit bedrag uit laten betalen, maar je kunt er bijvoorbeeld ook extra vrije dagen voor kopen. Jij kiest wat bij jou past.
* 24,5 vakantiedagen per jaar, ruim aan te vullen met 35 dagen vanuit je IKB (op fulltime basis).
* een eindejaarsuitkering in december van 6% van je jaarsalaris
* vergoedingen voor studies en trainingen. Alliander vergoedt in de meeste gevallen jouw gehele opleiding.
* een NS-Business Card, zodat je duurzaam kan reizen. Kom je met eigen vervoer? Dan krijg je een kilometertegemoetkoming.


Natuurlijk hebben we nog veel meer! Lees meer over al jouw arbeidsvoorwaarden.

 **Voor jou net wat meer informatie**


Samen maken we het net beter. Voor iedereen, met iedereen. En daar hoor jij bij! Solliciteer via de sollicitatiebutton op deze vacature voor 1 september 2024. Binnen 5 werkdagen krijg je een reactie van ons.

title: Google Cloud Data Engineer
description:
##### **Location: Belgium or The Netherlands**



As a GCP data engineer you are responsible to deliver end-to-end data solutions, enabling your clients to make data-driven decisions based on your solution by collecting, transforming and publishing data.



You enjoy designing, developing, and maintaining robust data pipelines and data architectures on Google Cloud Platform (GCP).


**The impact you'll make**
--------------------------


By designing and implementing scalable data pipelines, ensuring efficient data flow and processing. You will optimize data storage, enable real-time analytics, and enhance data security. By leveraging GCP's advanced tools, you facilitate data-driven decision-making, improve operational efficiency, and support business growth through insightful analytics and streamlined data management.



Your expertise drives impactful data solutions.


**Your skills**
---------------


Design, develop, maintain and optimize data pipelines on GCP


Build and manage data warehouses and data lakes using GCP services like BigQuery, Cloud Storage, and Dataflow.


Strong proficiency in GCP services such as BigQuery, Cloud Dataflow, Cloud Pub/Sub, Cloud Storage, and Cloud Composer.


Expertise in SQL and experience with relational and NoSQL databases.


Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, Spark, or Scala.


Experience with ETL tools and frameworks

**Your values**
---------------


Eager to work as a team


Ready to take on a challenge


Curious for new technologies


Fond of data


Cloud-minded

**What's in it for you?**
-------------------------


Work with cutting-edge technology in the field of data engineering


Stay current with the latest developments and best practices on GCP


Engage in continuous (peer)learning

Participate on a tactical level within our company


Enjoy an open and informal company culture


Collaborate with awesome colleagues

**Why Agiliz**
--------------


We’re a team of about 50 people, all interested in data and analytics. Fun, informal and open communication define us. We’re like a small village where everyone knows everyone and we’re always willing to lend a hand to our neighbour.

  

We don’t limit ourselves to one technology or one business sector, the variety in projects and technology stack in addition to our knowledge sharing culture is one of the reasons why applicants choose for us.

  

Although we believe that our love for team events, food and good vibes might have something to do with it as well.

title: Bridge Developer intern
description:
Eindhoven, Netherlands
Category
 Research & Development
Posted Date
 07/03/2024
Job Id
 341422
  
Want to work on the world’s leading smart home lighting system? This role is in IoT development team within Hue Connected R&D in The Netherlands, and you will be working alongside other software engineers on one of the world’s largest commercial IoT systems. The team is continuously improving the IoT functionality by a/o improving the performance and availability of the services, so a customer-first mentality must be in your DNA.

  

Working for Signify means being creative and adaptive while working in a fast-paced company. Our culture of continuous learning and commitment to diversity and inclusion creates an environment that allows you to build your skills and career while transforming our industry.

  

As the world leader in lighting, we’re constantly ahead of the curve. Through our leadership in connected lighting and the Internet of Things, we’re breaking new ground in data analytics, AI, and smart homes, offices, cities and more!

  

Signify is one of the few companies in the world to achieve carbon neutrality and our next sustainability goals are even bolder: doubling our positive impact on the environment and society by 2025.

**What you'll do**
------------------

  

The Hue bridge is the heart of the Philips Hue ecosystem. It connects the mobile apps to our lights, it controls all the automations within your setup, and it connects to the cloud for things like out of home control and voice control.

  

With this assignment, you will work along with the IoT team within the Business Line Hue Connected in Eindhoven to look at opportunities to move to a different embedded Linux build system.

**Your qualifications**
-----------------------

* You are finalizing a Bachelor degree in the field of Computer Science / Software Engineering.
* Available for minimally 6-8 months (> 32 hrs/week) and able to start your internship in September - October 2024.
* Proactive and enthusiastic to communicate with senior stakeholders.
* A self-starter who has an affinity with software technology.
* You are proud of what you do, have a deep passion to do things right, and are ready to learn on the job.
* You have experience with Linux, know how to get it bootstrapped on hardware..
* You have experience with C, C++, Rust, Python, Bash; some knowledge of C# is considered a great bonus.
* You understand the agile development process, and you know how to use Git-based tools.
**What you’ll get in return…**
------------------------------

* Internship allowance: the exact amount depends on your situation (also towards rented accommodation or public transportation).
* Paid leave based on 1 day per month.
* Extensive set of tools to drive your career, such as a personalized learning platform.
* Opportunity to purchase products at reduced prices.
* Opportunity to be part of a team managing one of the world’s largest fleets of IoT connected products.
  

We’re offering multiple opportunities for career development, like mentoring, coaching and stretch assignments, with strong international exposure for dynamic profiles. Learning is fundamental to our culture. Through continuous learning, we are transforming the industry. You have the chance to learn every day, acquire new skills and perspectives through customized online programs, and on-the-job experiences.

  

See #SignifyLife through the eyes of our employees!

**What we promise…**
--------------------

  

We’re committed to the continuous development of our employees, using our learning to shape the future of light and create a sustainable future. Join the undisputed leader in the lighting industry and be part of our diverse global team.

  

Notes

* EU/EER students: In order to be considered for this internship, you need to be registered as a student during the entire internship period. Formal documentation of this may be requested at any time.
* Non-EU students in Dutch Universities: You need to be registered as a student and your university needs to sign the Nuffic Agreement. The internship needs to be a compulsory part of your studies (receive ECTS in turn). In case of non-compulsory internship, you need to have a letter from the university in which it states that your internship contributes to your personal development, what your learning goals are and what tasks you will undertake during your internship. The letter has to be signed and stamped by your university.
* Non-EU students in non-Dutch Universities: You need to be registered as a student and the internship should be a compulsory part of your studies. Also, you need to be able to get the official approval of your university for this internship (Nuffic agreement).

Please apply only if you can meet the aforementioned requirements.

title: Communication Officer – Quantum Internet
description:
Communication Officer – Quantum Internet
 Apply Now
Job description


Are you proactive, passionate and ready for a new meaningful challenge? Do you already have experience as a communication advisor and outreach manager and a passion or background in Science? This role is for you!



In this unique role, you will be working at QuTech, dedicating all your efforts to QIA, the Quantum Internet Alliance. As a Communication officer, you will have the opportunity to become an integral part of QIA, a collaboration involving more than 40 industrial and academic organizations across Europe.



QIA's mission is to build a global Quantum Internet by developing a full-stack prototype network that validates all key subsystems. Additionally, QIA aims to foster an innovative European Quantum Internet ecosystem, capable of scaling all sub-systems to achieve world-leading European technology.



Find out more about QIA at https://quantuminternetalliance.org/



As our Communication officer your responsibilities will be to raise awareness about the Quantum Internet Alliance (QIA) and its mission and execute various activities such as:



Your responsibilities will include:


* Engaging with the communication offices of QIA partners to align, support, and monitor the writing and publication of press releases and news articles, and promoting them through QIA channels.
* Preparing QIA’s monthly newsletter.
* Providing communication and outreach support for QIA activities such as QIA Hackathons, Use Case Challenges, the QIA Technology Forum…
* Creating rich media outreach materials for print and online use.
* Managing QIA’s social media channels (LinkedIn and Twitter) and online collaboration platforms (Teams and Slack), including but not limited to engaging with relevant stakeholders, answering queries and monitoring analytics.
* Organizing QIA’s participation in industry events, and providing support in QIA-organized events.
* Managing the QIA website, including content creation by writing and publishing news updates and other content, website maintenance, and SEO optimization using best practices and analyzing website metrics.
* Managing QIA’s social media presence by developing content strategies, creating relevant campaigns and engaging posts, increasing engagement with QIA results, and analyzing social media performance to adjust strategies as needed.


Requirements


We are looking for a Communication officer who is hands on, creative with 3 years of experience at least in communication, outreach and community building, preferably in a technical environment.



Furthermore you have:


* HBO or Bachelors’ Degree
* Knowledge of CMS and social media marketing & analytics tools.
* Ability to work in a large consortium of partners across several European countries.
* Interest in quantum technology.


**Dutch citizenship or a European working permit is required to apply. For this role ideally we would like someone to be able to start in September or latest October.**


Conditions of employment


This is a replacement for a maternity cover, we will offer you a 10th month contract which can be extended if needed. The UFO profile is Communication officer 1 with a full-time salary based on VSNU-CAO Scale 9 (3377 Euros to 4640 Euros).



Additionally, you will also receive:


* A choice of working contract from 24 h to 32 h per week.
* 8% holiday allowance and an end-of-year bonus of 8.3%.
* An excellent pension scheme via the ABP.
* The possibility to compile an individual employment package every year.
* Discount on health insurance.
* Flexible working week.
* Every year, 232 leave hours (at 38 hours). You can also sell or buy additional leave hours via the individual choice budget.
* Attention for working healthy and energetically with the vitality program.


TU Delft


Delft University of Technology is built on strong foundations. As creators of the world-famous Dutch waterworks and pioneers in biotech, TU Delft is a top international university combining science, engineering and design. It delivers world class results in education, research and innovation to address challenges in the areas of energy, climate, mobility, health and digital society. For generations, our engineers have proven to be entrepreneurial problem-solvers, both in business and in a social context.



At TU Delft we embrace diversity as one of our core values and we actively engage to be a university where you feel at home and can flourish. We value different perspectives and qualities. We believe this makes our work more innovative, the TU Delft community more vibrant and the world more just. Together, we imagine, invent and create solutions using technology to have a positive impact on a global scale. That is why we invite you to apply. Your application will receive fair consideration.



Challenge. Change. Impact!


QuTech


QuTech is a mission-driven research institute run jointly by Delft University of Technology (TU Delft) and the Netherlands Organization for Applied Scientific Research (TNO). Together, we work on a radically new technology with world-changing potential, developing scalable prototypes of a quantum computer and an intrinsically safe quantum internet.



We are creating the quantum future, and we believe that quantum technology will be a game changer in many social and economic sectors – including health, agriculture, climate and safety. To achieve our ambitious goals, we bring together scientists, engineers and industry in an inspiring environment, with plenty of space for ambition, entrepreneurship and innovation. Our research and engineering activities are conducted in three divisions: Quantum Computing, Quantum Internet and Qubit Research. 220 FTE and over 300 curious people work in our divisions and support teams, and we actively welcome new colleagues who share our vision and enthusiasm.



Have a look at our video and get a glimpse of QuTech.


Application procedure


For information about this position, you can contact Vlora Rexhepi- van der Pol, QIA Innovation Manager at V.Rexhepi-vanderPol@tudelft.nl



For questions concerning the procedure please contact Audrey Monje, Senior Recruiter at QuTech at A.monje@tudelft.nl



If you are interested in this position, please apply via the application button on this page before the 28th July 2024.



The applications submitted will be reviewed on a rolling basis and the position maybe closed for application if a suitable candidate is found.


FACULTY/DEPARTMENT### **QuTech**

JOB TYPE### **Marketing and communications**

SCIENTIFIC FIELD### **not applicable**

HOURS PER WEEK### **24h to 32h**

SALARY### **€ 3.377,00 - € 4.640,00**

DESIRED LEVEL OF EDUCATION### **Secondary Vocational higher level +**

VACANCY NUMBER### **TUD05525**


Apply Now

title: Quantitative Engineer - AMD Public MAS Strats - Analyst - The Hague
description:
Quantitative Engineer - AMD Public MAS Strats - Analyst - The Hague**Goldman Sachs Asset & Wealth Management:**
  

As one of the world's leading asset managers, our mission is to help our clients achieve their investment goals. To best serve our clients' diverse and evolving needs, we have built our business to be global, broad and deep across asset classes, geographies and solutions.
  

Goldman Sachs Asset & Wealth Management is one of the world's leading asset management institutions. AWM delivers innovative investment solutions managing close to Two Trillion US Dollars on a global, multi-product platform. In addition to traditional products (e.g. Equities, Fixed Income) our product offering also includes Hedge Funds, Private Equity, Fund of Funds, Quantitative Strategies, Fundamental Equity and a Multi-Asset Pension Solutions Business. Software is engineered in a fast-paced, dynamic environment, adapting to market and customer needs to deliver robust solutions in an ever-changing business environment.
  

**What We Do**
  

Multi-Asset Solutions, "MAS" is an investing group within the Asset Management Division at Goldman Sachs. MAS is responsible for managing customized multi-asset class portfolios and funds, including discretionary mandates for US and international public pension plans, sovereign wealth funds and insurance companies and providing outsourced CIO services. The team is comprised of professionals with deep and varied investment backgrounds who specialize in designing and implementing customized multi-asset class portfolios.
  

Our Engineering and Strategist teams are responsible for building portfolio management and asset allocation tools to help our portfolio managers and clients make critical investment decisions for multi-billion dollar portfolios. We also build quantitative models that underpin our investment philosophy and process.
  

**Who We Look For**
  

We are looking for quantitative engineers to join our Strats team to help with core initiatives to deliver our next-generation digital experience to internal and external users using open source tools and frameworks. Our goal is to build scalable, extensible tools that have immediate impact on a growing user base and will serve our needs in the long term to outperform our competitors. We are a fun, entrepreneurial team that loves coding, investing, and turning our ideas into reality. We are looking for creative, self-driven developers who want to grow and learn from others in a fast-paced environment. The ideal candidate has a strong mix of software engineering and quantitative backgrounds. You have a track record with JavaScript front and back-end frameworks or Python. You enjoy working with end users to understand the problem at hand and help design the solution, and are excited to learn about investment finance and portfolio management concepts. You will engineer software across all phases of the software development life cycle: partnering with MAS investing professionals to design new features, building those features, creating, and running tests, receiving feedback, and delivering enhancements.
  

**Requirements**
  

* Bachelors, Masters or equivalent experience in computer science, mathematics or engineering
* Meaningful experience in, but not limited to, any of the following: Javascript frameworks (React/Angular/Node), MongoDB/NoSQL, SQL, Python
* Strong knowledge of data structures, algorithms and object oriented programming
* Strong communication skills, ability to work on a fast-paced team and collaborate with stakeholders and end users
* Knowledge of or interest in learning investment finance, portfolio theory and analytics (portfolio optimization, simulation or glidepath)
* 1-2+ years of relevant work experience
  

  

  

ABOUT GOLDMAN SACHS
  

  

At Goldman Sachs, we commit our people, capital and ideas to help our clients, shareholders and the communities we serve to grow. Founded in 1869, we are a leading global investment banking, securities and investment management firm. Headquartered in New York, we maintain offices around the world.
  

  

We believe who you are makes you better at what you do. We're committed to fostering and advancing diversity and inclusion in our own workplace and beyond by ensuring every individual within our firm has a number of opportunities to grow professionally and personally, from our training and development opportunities and firmwide networks to benefits, wellness and personal finance offerings and mindfulness programs. Learn more about our culture, benefits, and people at GS.com/careers.
  

  

We're committed to finding reasonable accommodations for candidates with special needs or disabilities during our recruiting process. Learn more: https://www.goldmansachs.com/careers/footer/disability-statement.html
  

  

© The Goldman Sachs Group, Inc., 2023. All rights reserved.
  

Goldman Sachs is an equal employment/affirmative action employer Female/Minority/Disability/Veteran/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity

title: Data Platform Engineer
description:
You design, build and operationalize data processing platforms, advocating the DevOps culture in the Data & Analytics domains.  

**How do I become a Data Platform Engineer at Coolblue?**  

  

You design, build and operationalize data processing platforms (Airflow, Kafka) with an emphasis on security and compliance; scalability and efficiency; reliability and fidelity; and flexibility and portability.  

  

You leverage the power of event-driven architectures to deliver outstanding performance to all aspects of our Customer Experience, highlighting Customer Journey, Business Analysis, Marketing, Data Science.  

  

You are keen to be part of a team that supports more than 500 colleagues through the usage/adoption of these platforms, troubleshooting, documenting and training the staff.  

  

You enjoy thinking about scalability, operational systems (Linux, OSX), load balancers, system tuning, configuration management, infra as code (AWS's Cloud Formation, CDK, Terraform), process automation, CI/CD (Teamcity), observability (Datadog) - a real data platform guru! Would you also like to become a Data Platform Engineer at Coolblue? Read below if the job suits you.  

  

**You enjoy doing this**  

* Designing data platforms on AWS and/or Google Cloud, and bringing the DataOps/SRE culture to the Data & Analytics domains.
* Enabling over 70 development teams to share and consume data in formats appropriate to their systems and applications, as well as empowering Analytics Engineers, Data Scientists, and Data Analysts to generate new insights.
* Learning new technologies through online courses, conferences, hands-on activities, POCs, hackathons, pitching ideas, and helping define the roadmap for Data Governance at Coolblue.
* Getting hands-on with different AWS services and Docker, and ensuring that our data platforms are scalable, secure, fast, and cost-effective.
* Being proactive and engaging with your colleagues and stakeholders to identify new work opportunities.
* Working with an Agile/startup mindset, focused on improving our customer journey.
* Coding in Python and being open to other languages as well.
* Sharing knowledge through pairing, code reviews, presenting, training, and coaching your colleagues.

  

  

**You recognize yourself in the following**  

* You have experience deploying distributed applications on the cloud to support Business Intelligence such as Airflow, Kafka.
* You have experience with Cloud Architecture on AWS and/or GCP.
* You have experience with Configuration Management (Terraform/Cloud Formation/CDK or equivalent).
* You have experience with Continuous Integration (Teamcity or equivalent), logging and monitoring (Datadog or equivalent).
* You have experience with helping others to improve their craftsmanship and technical skills.
* You breathe Agile.

  

  

**This is what you’re looking for in a job**  

* Money.
* Over 30 training courses at our own Coolblue University.
* Travel allowance and a retirement plan.
* 25 leave days. As long as you promise to come back.
* Travel allowance, a pension plan and where-you-work-money.
* A discount on all our products.
* Relocation assistance: from A to Z. We will make sure it goes well and give full support.
* An extraordinarily good work environment with colleagues from all over the world who make you happy, epic Coolblue parties, pubquizzing, and other activities.
* Room for new initiatives and ideas. We’re always open to those, whether you’ve been with us for a week, a month, or a year.
* A job at one of the fastest-growing companies in the Benelux.
* A picture-perfect office at a great location. You could crawl to work from Rotterdam Central Station. Though we recommend just walking for 2 minutes.
* At this moment we have a hybrid way of working: a combo between working from home and at the office. Of course we take care of a home office supplies. Including a desk chair, laptop and blue colored decoration.

title: Biological Data Scientist
description:
**Company Description** **The Company**


Syngenta is a leading developer and producer of seeds. We bring farmers more vigorous, stronger, resistant plants, including innovative hybrid varieties and biotech crops that can thrive even in challenging growing conditions. Each of our 28,000 employees in more than 90 countries work together to solve one of humanity’s most pressing challenges: growing more food with fewer resources. A diverse workforce and an inclusive workplace environment are enablers of our ambition to be the most collaborative and trusted team in agriculture.  

  

For a new opening in the team, we are looking for a:  

  

**Biological Data Scientist**

 **Job Description** **Into Action**


Are you ready to make a significant impact in the agricultural industry? Look no further! The Vegetable Seed Enhancement Team (VSET) at Syngenta is seeking a highly motivated and talented Data Scientist to join our dynamic team. As a Data Scientist at VSET, you will be an integral part of a multidisciplinary team, working closely with stakeholders across the vegetable business. Your primary focus will be on designing and implementing imaging technologies, algorithms, and artificial intelligence systems. By automating measurements and leveraging AI, you will gain a deep understanding of seed physiology and develop data-based solutions for the challenges faced by the global vegetable business.

**The Challenge**


When you are established in your role, you will work with the VSET team to;

* Automate seed and plant measurements, developing algorithms for predicting seed performance.
* Combine expertise in image analysis, machine learning, seed physiology, and biological experimentation.
* Lead implementation and technology transfer to processing sites.
* Actively participate in Syngenta's network of imaging and AI technologies.

  

**Qualifications** **Your Profile**

* To succeed in this role, you preferably have a Ph.D. or MSc degree with 3+ years of experience in machine learning and artificial intelligence or equivalent qualifications.
* You are familiar with machine/deep learning frameworks, such as TensorFlow, Keras, and PyTorch.
* Experience in deploying image analysis pipelines on the edge or in the cloud would be advantageous.
* It would be a big plus if you have a strong interest in developing skills in chemometrics, spectroscopy, hyperspectral imaging, and establish a strong basic understanding of seed and plant biology.
* You have good communication skills to interact with diverse internal stakeholders.


We will take care of a great onboarding, to make sure you feel comfortable and have all the necessary tools to start your new challenge.

 **Additional Information** **Your Chance!**


Join us at Syngenta and be part of a diverse and inclusive team that is passionate about shaping the future of sustainable agriculture. We offer a competitive salary package, excellent benefits and ample opportunities for professional growth and development.


If you recognize yourself in the profile and would like to apply for this position, please apply online via www.syngenta.com If you would like to have more information about this vacancy please contact our recruiter **Nienke Terluin** by email to nienke.terluin@syngenta.com
company_description: Syngenta is a global leader in agriculture where people from very diverse backgrounds are united by our purpose: bringing plant potential to life.

title: Google Data Engineer | Veghel | Sligro | Hybride
description:
**Bij Sligro zetten we groots in op Digital & Analytics. Wil jij werken in een innovatie- en datagedreven organisatie, écht waarde toevoegen en klaar voor de volgende stap in jouw carrière als Data Engineer? Kom dan onze snelgroeiende afdeling versterken als Medior Data Engineer in onze Google Cloud omgeving. Hier werken we met veel enthousiasme aan het realiseren van de digitale strategie van Sligro Food Group.**  

Ontdek waarom deze functie perfect is voor jou:  

**Draag bij aan de digitale transformatie**
Wij staan aan de vooravond van een hele grote stap in Digital & Analytics en daar kun jij vanaf het begin bij zijn! Bij ons krijg je de kans om je technische expertise in te zetten en verder te ontwikkelen binnen onze dynamische organisatie. Jij speelt een cruciale rol in het realiseren van onze data-driven strategie, waarbij je gebruik maakt van de nieuwste data technologieën binnen Google Cloud.  

**Onderdeel van een team van specialisten**  

Als Data Engineer werk je nauw samen met ons ervaren team van externe specialisten en draag je bij aan het ontwerpen, implementeren en optimaliseren van onze data-infrastructuur.  

Standaard Taken van een Data Engineer:
* Ontwerpen, bouwen en onderhouden van data pipelines en integratie patronen binnen de Google Cloud omgeving.
* Beheren en optimaliseren van dataopslag en verwerkingssystemen zoals BigQuery, Dataflow en Cloud Storage.
* Ontwikkelen van ELT-processen voor het verzamelen, transformeren en laden van data uit diverse bronnen met technieken als DBT en Fivetran.
* Automatiseren van data workflows om efficiëntie en schaalbaarheid te verbeteren.
* Samenwerken met data scientists en analisten om data-gedreven oplossingen te ontwikkelen.
* Troubleshooten en oplossen van complexe technische problemen met betrekking tot data-integratie en -verwerking.
* Up-to-date blijven met de nieuwste ontwikkelingen en best practices binnen Google Cloud en data engineering.


**Vereisten voor de functie**
Je bent onderdeel van een kritisch bedrijfsproces, daarom zoeken we natuurlijk ook mensen met een solide kennis en ervaring!
* **Ervaring**: Minimaal 3 jaar relevante werkervaring als Data Engineer, met specifieke ervaring in Google Cloud Platform (GCP) en de inrichting van een Data Warehouse en Data lake
* **Certificeringen**: Google Cloud Professional Data Engineer of vergelijkbare certificeringen zijn een sterke pre.
* **Technische Vaardigheden**: Uitgebreide kennis van en ervaring met BigQuery, Dataflow, Cloud Storage, Pub/Sub, Postgres, DBT, Cloud fundtions, Github actions en ondersteunende applicaties als Fivetran, SODA en Datadog.
* **Programmeervaardigheden**: Bekwaam in programmeertalen zoals Python, SQL, en Java, YAML, Go.
* **Data Modellering**: Ervaring met data modellering, Data Vault, databaseontwerp en optimalisatie van query-prestaties.
* **Probleemoplossend Vermogen:** Sterke analytische vaardigheden en het vermogen om complexe technische problemen op te lossen.
* **Communicatie:** Uitstekende communicatievaardigheden in zowel Nederlands als Engels, zowel mondeling als schriftelijk.
* **Teamspeler:** In staat om effectief samen te werken in een multidisciplinair team en bij te dragen aan een positieve teamdynamiek.


Als jij aan deze eisen voldoet en enthousiast bent om een verschil te maken in onze Google Cloud omgeving, dan nodigen wij je graag uit om te solliciteren en deel uit te maken van ons innovatieve team!  


**Wat wij jou bieden****:**
* Geld;
* 25 vakantiedagen, als je belooft terug te komen;
* Reiskostenvergoeding;
* Laptop en telefoon;
* Een uitgebreide pensioenregeling;
* Toegang tot onze eigen Sligro Academy met meer dan 200+ trainingen;
* Een gezellige Brabantse cultuur;
* Een Sligro pas waarmee jij 10% korting krijgt in onze vestigingen!


**nteresse?**
Solliciteren kan gemakkelijk via de sollicitatiebutton. Heb je vragen? Neem dan contact op met Recruiter Peet Klaassen via 06-27458974 of peetklaassen@sligro.nl.  

  

**Over Sligro Food Group**  

Sligro Food Group bestaat uit verschillende foodservicebedrijven. Samen met onze klanten hebben we **één belangrijke passie: food.** Om ervoor te zorgen dat iedereen zich daarop kan richten, worden alle bedrijven vanuit ons hoofdkantoor in Veghel ondersteund. Zo kunnen de verschillende bedrijven zich regionaal richten op die passie.  

  

Op het hoofdkantoor werken we **intensief samen.** Dat uit zich in een professionele en efficiënte organisatie. We zijn **trots op onze passie** en **gezond eigenwijs** waar nodig. Kijk hier voor meer informatie over Sligro Food Group.  

  

**Voor iedereen een plek!** Sligro Food Group vindt het vanuit haar sociale hart en maatschappelijke betrokkenheid belangrijk dat iedereen een kans krijgt om deel te nemen aan de arbeidsmarkt en dus ook bij Sligro kan werken.

title: Senior Data Engineer - Big Data
description:
It's fun to work in a company where people truly BELIEVE in what they are doing!*We're committed to bringing passion and customer focus to the business.*
Senior Data Engineer – Big Data with supply chain functional domain project background
Job Description
As a Senior Data Engineer, you will be responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining scalable big data solutions to support the agriculture supply chain operations of our client. Leveraging your extensive experience with Cloudera Hadoop and other big data technologies, you will build robust data pipelines, data warehouses, and analytics platforms that can handle large volumes of structured and unstructured data from across the agriculture supply chain.
Key Responsibilities:* Architect and implement end-to-end big data solutions using the Cloudera Hadoop ecosystem (HDFS, Hive, Impala, Spark, etc.)
* Design and develop efficient data ingestion, transformation, and loading processes to integrate data from various sources across the agriculture supply chain
* Create scalable data storage and processing frameworks to support real-time and batch analytics
* Implement data quality checks, data lineage, and data governance practices to ensure data integrity
* Work closely with data scientists and business analysts to understand requirements and translate them into technical solutions
* Optimize system performance, monitor, and troubleshoot issues in the big data infrastructure
* Mentor and guide junior data engineers on best practices and new technologies
* Document technical designs, processes, and procedures for knowledge sharing and future maintenance


Required Skills and Experience:* 8-12 years of experience as a Data Engineer or Big Data Engineer
* Expertise in designing and implementing Cloudera Hadoop-based data platforms
* Proficient in Python, Scala, or Java for developing data processing pipelines
* Strong understanding of data modeling, ETL, and data warehousing concepts
* Experience with big data technologies such as Spark, Kafka, Hive, Impala, Sqoop, and Flume
* Familiarity with cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP) and containerization technologies (Docker, Kubernetes)
* Hands-on experience in the agriculture or supply chain domain
* Excellent problem-solving, analytical, and communication skills
* Ability to work in a team and mentor junior engineers


Preferred Qualifications:* Master's degree in Computer Science, Data Science, or a related field
* Certifications in Cloudera, Hadoop, or other big data technologies
* Experience in agile software development methodologies


If you like wild growth and working with happy, enthusiastic over-achievers, you'll enjoy your career with us!
Not the right fit? Let us know you're interested in a future opportunity by clicking *Introduce Yourself* in the top-right corner of the page or create an account to set up email alerts as new job postings become available that meet your interest!

title: Programme Director The Statistics and Data Science Innovation Hub (Fixed Term for 12 Months)
description:
**Site Name:** UK – London – New Oxford Street, Amsterdam, Belgium-Wavre, Siena, USA - Pennsylvania - Upper Providence  

**Posted Date:** Jul 5 2024  

GSK has an inspiring ambition: by uniting science, technology and talent we aim to positively impact the health of 2.5 billion people over the next ten years. We will get ahead of disease together with our R&D approach of focusing on the science of the immune system, human genetics and advanced technologies, such as functional genomics and AI/ML.

**Job Purpose:**

Fixed Term for 12 months.


The Statistics and Data Science Innovation Hub (SDSIH) department is a group of expert technical statisticians and data scientists developing cutting edge statistical methodologies and consulting on the application of advanced techniques to expedite delivery of our portfolio. Our team is accountable for several high priority projects, spanning Development aimed at accelerating our portfolio and driving new paradigms through data-enabled disruption of our clinical drug development model.


The Program Director will be accountable for overseeing and managing a select portfolio of transformative projects. The priority focus will be on cross-enterprise projects but may also include selected other projects led by SDSIH senior leaders, according to project priorities and capacity.


The role will orchestrate and expedite project delivery within scope, budget and agreed schedule to realise organisational outcomes and benefits. As part of this they will need to be adept at implementing and operating strong project governance and associated project management controls and processes.


This role involves close collaboration with senior leaders and will be required to collaborate with other project and change managers across R&D.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Provide hands-on portfolio and project management support for priority SDSIH-led projects to ensure successful and expedited delivery of key projects.
* Assist SDSIH leadership in developing and communicating the program’s overall vision and direction.
* Oversee relationships with accountable senior leaders and collaborate with other project and change managers to ensure cohesive delivery.
* Develop and maintain comprehensive portfolio and project plans, including scope, objectives, deliverables, timelines, resources, and budgets.
* Effectively track and report project progress, risks, issues, and KPIs/benefits. Proactively manage project team delivery/inputs and stakeholder expectations, ensuring ongoing alignment on project scope/objectives and outcomes/benefits.
* Proactively identify and assess risks, dependencies, and issues. Facilitate the development and tracking of effective mitigation plans to minimize impacts on project delivery/success.
* Monitor resource capacity/requirements, identifying necessary adjustments for efficient delivery. Integrate plans with SDSIH’s Jira-based project & capacity overview approach.
* Manage contracts with vendors and suppliers
* Oversee the development of project documentation/information and storage, leveraging digital tools for efficiency (e.g. Jira, MS SharePoint/Teams).
* Operate effective quality management processes to ensure that project deliverables meet the necessary quality standards and success criteria. Conduct/facilitate periodic project reviews / health checks to assess project performance and compliance and manage corrective actions and continuous improvement initiatives to optimize project processes and outcomes.
* Manage controlled project closure and transition to BAU.

**Basic Qualifications**

* Bachelor's degree in business administration, Organizational Development, or a related field.
* Strong experience in project management roles. Played a key role in providing project management support to the delivery of complex technical programs which have delivered tangible business value.
* Experience working across organisational boundaries in global companies (via industry or consulting roles).
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to influence and engage stakeholders at all levels.
* Experience working on a breadth of types of digital/tech transformation projects with experience in statistical, data science, AI environment in particular
* Demonstrated ability to provide effective project management support within project delivery teams in a matrix management environment to drive well-coordinated and high-quality work.
* Experience and knowledge of the pharmaceutical industry.
* Experience in delivering data-related transformation projects.
* Experience with use of Jira and agile methodology.

**Preferred Qualifications**

* PPM certification such as PMP, MSP, PRINCE2 etc., preferred
* Advanced degree
* Statistical degree


#LI-GSK\*

**Why GSK?**

**Uniting science, technology and talent to get ahead of disease together.**

GSK is a global biopharma company with a special purpose – to unite science, technology and talent to get ahead of disease together – so we can positively impact the health of billions of people and deliver stronger, more sustainable shareholder returns – as an organisation where people can thrive. We prevent and treat disease with vaccines, specialty and general medicines. We focus on the science of the immune system and the use of new platform and data technologies, investing in four core therapeutic areas (infectious diseases, HIV, respiratory/ immunology and oncology).


Our success absolutely depends on our people. While getting ahead of disease together is about our ambition for patients and shareholders, it’s also about making GSK a place where people can thrive. We want GSK to be a place where people feel inspired, encouraged and challenged to be the best they can be. A place where they can be themselves – feeling welcome, valued, and included. Where they can keep growing and look after their wellbeing. So, if you share our ambition, join us at this exciting moment in our journey to get Ahead Together.


As an Equal Opportunity Employer, we are open to all talent. In the US, we also adhere to Affirmative Action principles. This ensures that all qualified applicants will receive equal consideration for employment without regard to neurodiversity, race/ethnicity, colour, national origin, religion, gender, pregnancy, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression, age, disability, genetic information, military service, covered/protected veteran status or any other federal, state or local protected class\*(\*US only).


We believe in an agile working culture for all our roles. If flexibility is important to you, we encourage you to explore with our hiring team what the opportunities are.


Should you require any adjustments to our process to assist you in demonstrating your strengths and capabilities contact us on Ukdiversity.recruitment@gsk.com or 0808 234 4391.


Please note should your enquiry not relate to adjustments, we will not be able to support you through these channels. However, we have created a UK Recruitment FAQ guide. Click the link and scroll to the Careers Section where you will find answers to multiple questions we receive .


As you apply, we will ask you to share some personal information which is entirely voluntary. We want to have an opportunity to consider a diverse pool of qualified candidates and this information will assist us in meeting that objective and in understanding how well we are doing against our inclusion and diversity ambitions. We would really appreciate it if you could take a few moments to complete it. Rest assured, Hiring Managers do not have access to this information and we will treat your information confidentially.

**Important notice to Employment businesses/ Agencies**


GSK does not accept referrals from employment businesses and/or employment agencies in respect of the vacancies posted on this site. All employment businesses/agencies are required to contact GSK's commercial and general procurement/human resources department to obtain prior written authorization before referring any candidates to GSK. The obtaining of prior written authorization is a condition precedent to any agreement (verbal or written) between the employment business/ agency and GSK. In the absence of such written authorization being obtained any actions undertaken by the employment business/agency shall be deemed to have been performed without the consent or contractual agreement of GSK. GSK shall therefore not be liable for any fees arising from such actions or any fees arising from any referrals by employment businesses/agencies in respect of the vacancies posted on this site.


Please note that if you are a US Licensed Healthcare Professional or Healthcare Professional as defined by the laws of the state issuing your license, GSK may be required to capture and report expenses GSK incurs, on your behalf, in the event you are afforded an interview for employment. This capture of applicable transfers of value is necessary to ensure GSK’s compliance to all federal and state US Transparency requirements. For more information, please visit GSK’s Transparency Reporting For the Record site.

title: Research Fellow in Socio-technical Innovation Aspects of Sepsis Diagnostics
description:
#### **Key takeaways**

* Hours
38 - 40 hr.
* Salary indication
Salary gross/monthly  

based on full-time
€ 3,877 - € 5,090
* Deadline
12 Aug 2024


Sepsis is a deadly, complex and fast-evolving condition. Current diagnostic techniques are time-consuming and limited in scope, requiring several different tests to be run to obtain a comprehensive picture of the patient's condition. The NWO-funded project SepsPIC aims to develop a sensor-based device that can quickly and accurately detect multiple sepsis biomarkers enabling doctors to make more informed decisions and improving patient outcomes.



Do you want to explore the usability, usefulness and conditions for using such a new sensor in clinical practice? Then joining our interdisciplinary team may be the right place for you!



We are looking for a motivated, creative and open-minded postdoc researcher who will work closely with sensor developers and interview, observe and work with clinicians and experts of sepsis to explore conditions for the embedding of this new diagnostic tool into clinical decision-making and pathways, explore alternative pathways, evaluate the acceptance and expected usability of multiplex sensors and machine-learning-based decisions and explore alternative material choices for responsible sensor design.


### **Your profile**

**Essential Requirements:**

* You have a PhD (completed or near completion) in a relevant field, such as human factors research, user research, health sciences, science, technology and innovation studies or similar;
* You are able to express yourself and understand Dutch at C2/C1 level, as you will work with clinical staff and operators and observe their processes;
* You have an excellent written and spoken command of English, as demonstrated by academic publications and presentations at international conferences.

**Ideally, you also have/ it is an advantage if you:**

* have experience in the health or healthcare systems and the medical device domain;
* are familiar with the process of supporting the design and testing of point of care and medical technology;
* are experienced in qualitative research methods including semi-structured interviews or observations;
* are an excellent team player and are passionate about working with scientists and practitioners from different backgrounds.
### **Our offer**

* An 18 month full-time postdoc position (part-time over an extended timeframe is possible as well)
* Working partially from home is possible
* An inspiring multidisciplinary, international academic environment
* Gross monthly salary between € 3.877 and € 5.090 (depending on experience and qualifications)
* A holiday allowance of 8% of the gross annual salary and a year-end bonus of 8.3%
* Excellent support for professional and personal development
* A solid pension scheme
* A total of 41 holiday days per year in case of full-time employment.
### **Information and application**



For questions about the position please approach Dr. Simone Borsci, e-mail: s.borsci@utwente.nl. Please submit your application **by the 12th of August, 2024**, and include:


* A cover letter of at most 1.5 pages A4, including a brief emphasizing your specific interest, qualifications and motivation to apply for this position;
* A full Curriculum Vitae, including the title of your dissertation and contact information for at least two academic references;
* Relevant diploma;

#### 


### **About the department**



You will be supervised by the PI Dr Simone Borsci (CODE) and Dr Kornelia Konrad (KiTeS). Ideally, you create linkages with both groups, but depending on your background and preference your main embedding may be with one or the other group.



The CoDE section consists of teachers and researchers with backgrounds in psychology, educational science, mathematics, or computer science. We teach courses on methodology, data-analysis, and cognitive psychology. Our research focuses on data-based solutions for societal problems related to education, health, and human factors. In our teaching and research, we make use of the latest developments in measurement and (large-scale) assessment, such as neurophysiology, extended reality, eye-tracking, psychometrics, and machine learning.



The KiTeS group is dedicated to analysing and improving the contribution of Knowledge to Transformations in Society to address intersecting societal and environmental challenges, including growing disparities and inequities, climate change, and biodiversity loss. The KiTeS group works across diverse disciplines and scholarly fields and draws on critical, historical, participatory, design-oriented, and arts-based methods and approaches. We work in different domains such as science and innovation policy, higher education, and environmental governance, and we collaborate closely with policymakers, social movements and grassroots organisations, cultural institutions, scientists and engineers, and business and financial institutions. Guided by values of justice, pluralism, sustainability, and care, our work is aimed at creating spaces for collaboration, critical analysis, reflection, and learning.


### **About the organisation**



The Faculty of Behavioral, Management and Social sciences (BMS) aims to play a key role in understanding, jointly developing and evaluating innovations in society. Technological developments are the engine of innovation. As a technical university that puts people first, we tailor them to human needs and behavior and use social engineering to integrate them into society. We also ensure adequate governance at public and private level, and robust, inclusive and fair organizational structures. We do this by developing, sharing and applying high-quality knowledge in Psychology, Business Administration, Public Administration, Communication Sciences, Philosophy, Educational Sciences and Health Sciences. Our research and education in these disciplines revolves around tackling and solving societal challenges. The research programs of BMS are closely linked to the research of the UT institutes Mesa+ Institute for Nanotechnology, TechMed Center and Digital Society Institute.



As an employer, the Faculty of BMS offers work that matters. We equip you to create new possibilities for yourself and for our society. With us, you will become part of a leading technical university with increasing, positive social impact. We offer an open, inclusive and entrepreneurial atmosphere, in which we encourage you to make healthy choices, for example through our flexible, adaptable benefits.
company_description: Join the university of technology that puts people first. Combine science, technology and social awareness at the University of Twente

title: Senior Application Scientist
description:
**Requisition ID :** **503940**


### **Job Description**

  

At IFF, we are passionate, creative, and empowered, we are constantly looking for new challenges—and developing new-to-world solutions that answer them. IFF is a multinational and growing company that invests in biotechnology to improve the sustainability, function, and value of our customers’ products.

  


The Home and Personal Care (HPC) team strives to be the preferred partner of our customers, delivering high-value, sustainable, and consumer relevant biobased solutions for the Home, Personal, and Industrial Care Markets. Our ingredient portfolio includes enzymes, biopolymers, and other bioactives for application in detergents, personal care products, textile processing and various industrial cleaning processes.

  


We are looking for an experienced application scientist, with proven track record of independently managing project teams and making an impact with customers, to strengthen our team and support the development of biobased solutions for detergents used for home & fabric care. In this role you will be based at our IFF Leiden site, The Netherlands and report to the Regional Application Lead. Our Leiden site is a dynamic and globally diverse hub, comprising 180 colleagues representing 29 nationalities. Our colleagues work across R&D, Application Development, and Commercial functions for our Health & Bioscience business, along with corporate staff.

  


**Key responsibilities**

  


As Senior Application Scientist you will identify, assess, and develop new product or application development concepts to provide valuable customer solutions. You will assist the organization with product improvements, competitive positioning of existing product offering and new product developments. You will work closely with R&D and marketing by providing voice of customer relative to product performance and expectations of product attributes. As a key member of the Application team, you will supervise and coach other team members on subjects such as application methods, design of experiment, data management and interpretation, and developing value propositions. You have a hands-on mentality and participate in the setup and execution of lab experiments as well as lab improvement projects. Lab experiments include biochemical analysis of enzymatic detergent formulations, stability testing, and product performance appraisal in e.g., washing machines and dishwashers. You will represent IFF at key industry meetings and conferences and build a network with a variety of internal and external stakeholders.

  

### **Job Requirements**

  

* Academic degree (MSc or PhD) in a relevant bioscience, chemical or engineering discipline.
* 6-15 years’ work experience in the detergent, personal care, chemical, or (food) ingredient industry, preferably in a technical support or application development role.
* Good interpersonal skills and ability to build and maintain relationships.
* Proactive, and self-starting personality.
* Strong communication skills. Proficiency in English, both written and verbal.
* Team-player who enjoys working in an international environment.
* Based or willing to relocate to The Netherlands.

  



We are a global leader in taste, scent and nutrition, offering our customers a broader range of natural solutions and accelerating our growth strategy. At IFF, we believe that your uniqueness unleashes our potential. We value the diverse mosaic of the ethnicity, national origin, race, age, sex or veteran status. We strive for an inclusive workplace that allows each of our colleagues to bring their authentic self to work regardless of their religion, gender identity & expression, sexual orientation, or disability.


Visit IFF.com/careers/workplace-diversity-and-inclusion to learn more.
