title: Senior Data Engineer
description:
Translate this page
In het zuiden van Limburg ligt een mooie functie voor je klaar: Senior Data Engineer bij de afdeling Informatiemanagement inkomensverzekeraar Loyalis. Iets voor jou? Solliciteer vandaag nog op deze IT vacature!


Loyalis beschermt inkomens tegen onverwachte gebeurtenissen, zoals arbeidsongeschiktheid en werkloosheid. Bij dit sympathieke bedrijf kun jij aan de slag als Senior Data Engineer binnen het DevOps-team Datamanagement. Tot het eind van het jaar hou je je bezig met de lopende migratie van data en infrastructuur naar een Microsoft Azure Cloud-oplossing. Daarna richt je je op de doorontwikkeling van het Azure-platform en de bijbehorende rapportages. Kies jij voor een cruciale rol in het ontwerpen, ontwikkelen, testen en implementeren van cloud-gebaseerde oplossingen? Solliciteer vandaag nog en word Senior Data Engineer bij Loyalis!


***Dit ga je doen als Data Engineer bij a.s.r.***
-------------------------------------------------

* je levert samen met andere Ontwikkelaars, Analisten en de operationele teams innovatieve oplossingen die voldoen aan de vereisten van de organisatie
* je verdiept je samen met cross-functionele teams in de behoeften van klanten en vertaalt deze naar technische specificaties
* je ziet er op toe dat oplossingen die gerealiseerd worden binnen het DevOps-team voldoen aan gestelde normen, richtlijnen en architectuurprincipes
* je creëert en onderhoudt geautomatiseerde processen voor het bouwen, testen en implementeren van software met tools zoals Azure DevOps, Git en CI/CD-pijplijnen
* in je rol van richtinggevende sparringpartner voor andere Developers zorg je ervoor dat ontwikkelde oplossingen voldoen aan de gestelde normen en richtlijnen en aan de architectuurprincipes

***Deze vacature is echt iets voor jou, want jij***
---------------------------------------------------


* hebt een hbo- ofwo-werkniveau en minimaal 3 jaar aantoonbare ervaring met het ontwerpen, ontwikkelen, testen en implementeren van cloudoplossingen op het Microsoft Azure-platform, bijvoorbeeld als Developer
* hebt ervaring met de volgende Azure-onderdelen: Azure Synapse, Azure Data Factory, Azure Delta Lake en Azure DevOps. Ervaring met Power BI is een pre
* hebt uitstekende programmeervaardigheden in Python/Pyspark en SQL
* hebt goede communicatieve vaardigheden en bent oplossingsgericht en innovatief
* bent in staat effectief samen te werken met het DevOps-team en andere stakeholders

***Dit bieden we je***
----------------------


* een bruto salaris van €4.900 - € 7.000 op basis van 38 uur per week, een 13e maand en 8% vakantievergoeding
* een heel goede pensioenregeling met een hoge bijdrage van de werkgever. Plus een aantrekkelijke thuiswerkvergoeding en kortingen op verzekeringen
* bij a.s.r. zijn we flexibel in thuiswerken: we werken gemiddeld 60% thuis en 40% op kantoor en je hebt veel ruimte om je eigen werktijden te bepalen
* een NS-Business Card met vrij reizen (ook privé) of een kilometervergoeding
* veel aandacht voor jouw persoonlijke ontwikkeling en vitaliteit
* werk waarmee je een positieve invloed hebt op de samenleving van morgen; samen stropen we onze mouwen op voor een eerlijkere en duurzamere toekomst

***Hier ga je werken als Data Engineer in Heerlen***
----------------------------------------------------

Je gaat aan de slag bij het team Datamanagement, dat een van de DevOps-teams is van de afdeling Informatie Management. Op deze afdeling werken ongeveer 50 collega's. Kenmerkend voor de werkwijze van Informatiemanagement Loyalis is: een agile mindset, sturen op agile principes, kort cyclisch werken volgens het scrum framework en het continu toevoegen van waarde voor de klant. Er is ruim gelegenheid om thuis te werken. Werken bij Loyalis heeft nog meer voordelen: volop opleidingsmogelijkheden, doorgroeikansen en een uitstekende werk/privébalans!


***Solliciteer op deze IT vacature***
-------------------------------------

Enthousiast geworden? Reageer via de button ‘solliciteer’. Wij geloven dat verschillen ons samen sterker en beter maken en voor ons tellen alleen je kwaliteiten. Daarom vinden we het prima als jij in jouw cv geen geboortedatum, geslacht en geboorteplaats opneemt.



Hier vind je meer informatie over het sollicitatieproces.



Neem bij vragen contact op met Renske Meijer (Recruiter): 06-82528238 / renske.meijer@asr.nl.

  

*Wij werken op een prettige manier samen met een aantal preferred suppliers. Acquisitie door werving- en selectie-, detachering- of uitzendbureaus wordt daarom niet op prijs gesteld.*
company_description: a.s.r. is the Dutch insurance company for all types of insurance.

title: Senior Data Scientist / Engineer Transaction Monitoring
description:
As a Senior Data Scientist/ Senior Data Engineer Transaction Monitoring you can have social impact, by catching the criminals using analytics models to analyse Rabobank transactions of 9+ million customers.

**You and your job**  

Preventing Money Laundering & Terrorist Financing is one of the key aspects for our society and our organisation, and as a bank we play a major role in this field. Within Rabobank we have built a data driven solution that analyses more than 11 million transactions per day to detect customers which launder money or finance terrorists. As behavioural patterns of criminals constantly evolve, our solution needs to adapt and evolve just as quickly. To keep our solution flexible and stable we need smart individuals like yourself who are passionate about building and improving our current Transaction Monitoring (TM) solution. One of the improvements we have identified for our solution is the introduction of more advanced analytics methodologies such as Machine Learning into our TM models.


To keep our Transaction Monitoring (TM) solution up to date to fight financial crime, you are passionate about data engineering, coding, designing and building complex (data) engines and related software infrastructure, solving (technical) performance and data-related functional challenges, helping colleagues to fulfil their (technical) requests and always looking for ways to do things smarter and better. This way you make sure Rabobank will be able to effectively fight financial crime!

**Practical examples**

* Develop and build scalable components (code bases) that allow for data processing and data generation on Big Data.
* Analyse source and output data to build knowledge and detect potential data-related problems.
* Anticipate potential future challenges of current infrastructure (e.g. performance issues) and together with the team design and implement solutions for these challenges.
* Test and monitor the performance of TM solution.
* Build a Machine Learning platform and orchestrating workflow of different models (ML Ops).
* Align with platform teams (which put code into production systems).

**Facts & Figures**

* 40+ other software engineers, data engineers and data scientists to collaborate with and learn from within the same team.
* 30+ other roles to collaborate with and learn from within the same team (e.g., Anti Money Laundering Experts, Analytics Translators and more).
* 44,000 Rabobank colleagues around the world.

**Top 3 responsibilities**

* Carry responsibility for (large parts of) the data and infrastructure of our TM solution, including infrastructure designs, good quality code and supporting your medior and junior colleagues to use best practices and follow the same way of working across the entire team.
* Lead alignment with adjacent fields (IT, Architecture, Data Science) to realize optimal performance of our data science model(s).
* Function as key counterpart for higher management.

**Together we achieve more than alone**  

We believe in the power of difference. Bringing together people's differences is what makes us an even better bank. So we are very curious about what you can bring to our team.


The 90+ people in our Transaction Monitoring team are responsible for detecting money laundering and terrorism financing risks, using analytics models. Working together is the way we work; as 1 multi-disciplinary, highly talented and motivated team at Rabobank. Talking of Rabobank: We are a Dutch bank that operates in 38 countries for over 9,500,000 customers. Together with these customers, our members and partners we stand side by side to create a world in which everyone has access to enough healthy food. In the Netherlands we work to create a country in which people are happy with how they live, work and do business.

**You and your talent**

* Academic degree (MSc / Phd) in Computer Science, Data Science, Econometrics or another STEM field.
* 5+ years’ experience in software development / data engineering / advanced analytics / Machine Learning (ideally with large data sets) working with Python and PySpark (Azure Databricks experience is a plus).
* Software development skills and good practices such as Git, release management, unit tests, testing strategy.
* Passionate about building large scale data solutions in an efficient and scalable manner.
* Analytical mindset and a critical way of thinking.
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English.
* Motivation to catch criminals by making our TM system more effective.
* Structured, precise, communicative, can work well with different people and roles, pro-active, has a business focus, natural curiosity and can-do mentality to make the difference in fighting financial crime. Thrives in a high-impact, dynamic and high-paced environment.

**This is what we offer you**

* A 36-hour works week with a salary in scale 9 (€ 4292 – € 5811) or scale 10 (€ 5115 – € 6900) depending on your experience. A 40-hour work week is also possible.
* An Employee Benefit Budget 11% of your monthly salary. You decide how to spend this budget.
* Thirteenth month's salary and 8% holiday allowance.
* Personal budget of € 1.400 to spend on activities related to your personal development and career flexible working times and location-independent working.
* Hybrid working (we work 1 or 2 days from the office a week) & flexible working times.

  

This is a selection of the terms of employment for a 36 hour working week. You can find all terms of employment on Employee benefits at Rabobank - Rabobank.  

  

**You and the job application process**

* Any questions about the job content? Contact: Nadia Vendrig, Expert Lead Transaction Monitoring Analytics via Nadia.Vendrig@rabobank.nl.
* Any questions about working at Rabobank and the process? Contact Lisa Boschma, corporate recruiter, via lisa.boschma@rabobank.nl. #LI-LB
* We will conduct the interviews through a video call.
* You can find answers to the most frequently asked questions on rabobank.jobs/en/faq.
* A security check is part of the process.
* We respect your privacy.

title: Senior Data Engineer
description:
**This is Adyen**



Adyen provides payments, data, and financial products in a single solution for customers like Meta, Uber, H&M, and Microsoft - making us the financial technology platform of choice. At Adyen, everything we do is engineered for ambition.



For our teams, we create an environment with opportunities for our people to succeed, backed by the culture and support to ensure they are enabled to truly own their careers. We are motivated individuals who tackle unique technical challenges at scale and solve them as a team. Together, we deliver innovative and ethical solutions that help businesses achieve their ambitions faster.


**Senior Data Engineer**



At Adyen, we treat data and data artifacts as first-class citizens. They form our backbone and drive the business and product insights we generate. To this end, Adyen is looking for a Senior Data Engineer to join our data solution in Amsterdam. We're looking for a person that understands the business context and the data needs behind it, and excels in implementing high-quality data pipelines on our Big Data Platform. As a Senior Data Engineer at Adyen, you will play a crucial role in shaping our data infrastructure and ensuring the seamless flow of data across various systems.


**What you'll do**


* **Collaborative Solution Development**: Engage with a diverse range of stakeholders, including data scientists, analysts, software engineers, product managers, and customers, to understand their requirements and craft effective solutions.
* **State-of-the-Art Pipelines and Architecture**: Design, develop, deploy and operate high-quality production ELT pipelines and data architectures. Integrate data from various sources and formats, ensuring compatibility, consistency, and reliability. Design scalable architectures.
* **Champion Data Best Practices**: Proactively establish and advocate for best practices in performance, code quality, data validation, data governance, and discoverability across Adyen through mentoring, training, and knowledge sharing.
* **High Quality Data and Code:** Ensure data is accurate, complete, reliable, relevant, and timely. Implement rigorous testing, monitoring and validation protocols for your code and data, leveraging tools such as Pytest.
* **Performance Optimization**: Identify and resolve performance bottlenecks in data pipelines and systems. Optimize query performance and resource utilization to meet SLAs and performance requirements, using technologies such as caching, indexing, partitioning, and other Spark optimizations.


**Who you are**


* **Experienced in Big Data:** Over 8 years of experience working as a Data Engineer or in a similar role.
* **Data & Engineering practices:** You possess an expert-level understanding of both Software and Data Engineering practices.
* **Technical Super Star:** Highly proficient in tools and languages such as: Python, PySpark, Airflow, Hadoop, Spark, Kafka, SQL, Git.
* **Clear Communicator:** Skilled at articulating complex data-related concepts and outcomes to a diverse range of stakeholders.
* **Self-starter:** Capable of independently recognizing opportunities, devising solutions, leading, prioritizing and owning projects.
* **Innovator:** You have an experimental mindset with a 'launch fast and iterate' mentality.
* **Data Culture Champion:** Experienced in fostering a data-centric culture within large, technical organizations and setting standards for excellence and continuous improvement.


**Data positions at Adyen**



We know companies handle different definitions for their data-related positions, this is for instance dependent on the size of a company. Since the birth of the Data Solution and the growth of all data streams, we categorized and defined all our positions. Have a look at this blogpost to find out!


**Our Diversity, Equity and Inclusion commitments**



Our unique approach is a product of our diverse perspectives. This diversity of backgrounds and cultures is essential in helping us maintain our momentum. Our business and technical challenges are unique, and we need as many different voices as possible to join us in solving them - voices like yours. No matter who you are or where you're from, we welcome you to be your true self at Adyen.



Studies show that women and members of underrepresented communities apply for jobs only if they meet 100% of the qualifications. Does this sound like you? If so, Adyen encourages you to reconsider and apply. We look forward to your application!


**What's next?**



Ensuring a smooth and enjoyable candidate experience is critical for us. We aim to get back to you regarding your application within 5 business days. Our interview process tends to take about 4 weeks to complete, but may fluctuate depending on the role. Learn more about our hiring process here. Don't be afraid to let us know if you need more flexibility.



This role is based out of our Amsterdam office. We are an office-first company and value in-person collaboration; we do not offer remote-only roles.
company_description: The Only Payment Solution You'll Ever Need | Wherever People Pay

title: Funding Developer
description:
Jij hebt veel kennis en ervaring van data verwerking, het ontwikkelen van nieuwe tooling en rapporten vanuit een data lake. Je bent creatief, hands-on en een echte teamplayer.

  

#### **Over Stater**


**Wie zijn wij?**
=================


Wie is Stater eigenlijk? Wellicht heb je nog nooit van ons gehoord, dus wij leggen je graag uit wat we doen. Binnen stater ontwikkelen en leveren wij hypothecaire diensten en platformen voor externe geldgevers. Met onze producten en diensten beheren wij 40% van de hypotheken in Nederland. Werken bij ons is dus werken bij een organisatie die midden in de maatschappij staat met producten die veel Nederlandse gezinnen (in) raken. Onze klanten zijn o.a. grote Nederlandse banken en andere geldverstrekkers.


#### **Over deze functie**


**Wat ga je doen?**
===================


Als Funding Developer in het BI Funding team heb je een belangrijke rol in het leveren van diensten ter ondersteuning van kapitaalmarkttransacties van onze klanten. Denk hierbij aan securitisaties en covered bonds. Door jouw kennis en ervaring van event gedreven/transactionele data verwerking, het ontwikkelen van nieuwe tooling met de beschikbare Microsoft Stack (SQL & Powershell) en rapporteren vanuit een Data Lake (d.m.v. ETL/Informatica/PySpark, Azure en PowerBI) ontwikkel je de Stater Pool Allocation Tool. Naast deze tool houd je je ook bezig met het ontwikkelen van verschillende informatieproducten gebaseerd op het Data Lake.


Collega’s zorgen voor een juiste selectie van leningen voor een transactie op basis van verschillende criteria en administreren deze in een pool. Jij bent verantwoordelijk voor het onderhoud, rapportages en het verder ontwikkelen van de pool allocation tool. Door in gesprek te gaan met de stakeholders en klanten kom de behoeftes te weten, samen met het team bedenk je manieren om de diensten te verbeteren, het funding porfolio verder uit te bouwen en vragen te beantwoorden. Jij bent in de lead om de stakeholders op de hoogte te houden en eventuele incidenten snel af te handelen.

  

#### **Skills**


**Naar wie zijn wij op zoek?**
==============================


Jij bent een echte IT engineer, door jouw jarenlange ervaring help je het team te verbeteren en realiseer je de doelstellingen. Niet alleen die van het team, maar ook van jezelf! Je vindt het fijn als er duidelijke communicatielijnen zijn, je bent resultaatgericht en je hebt oog voor detail. Je hebt al eens in de financiële dienstverlening gewerkt of het lijkt jou een uitdaging om dit te doen.


Jouw skills:

* Een Bachelor of Master diploma in Informatica of een andere IT-gerelateerde opleiding;
* Minimaal 3 jaar ervaring als ontwikkelaar in een Agile omgeving;
* Gedegen kennis van SQL Server, Powershell, VBScripting en HTA;
* Uitstekende communicatieve vaardigheden in Nederland;
* Bij voorkeur kennis van, of interesse in Finance.


**Wat bieden we je aan?**
=========================


Het begint natuurlijk bij een uitdagende functie en een werkomgeving waar jij je thuis voelt, maar ook de overige arbeidsvoorwaarden zijn uiteraard belangrijk. Hier een aantal van onze arbeidsvoorwaarden op een rijtje:

* Een organisatie waar jij centraal staat met maximale aandacht voor jouw ontwikkeling. Ons Stater Learning Center bied je op onze kosten de ruimte om sterker te worden op persoonlijk en inhoudelijk vlak. Interne doorgroei stimuleren en faciliteren wij.
* Ons salaris is opgebouwd uit 2 componenten. Naast een bruto maandsalaris van €4.904 tot €6.130,- (schaal 22), bieden wij een flexibel inzetbaar budget van maximaal €1.182,-. Waar zet jij dit budget voor in? Geniet je van extra vakantiedagen, laat je dit liever uitbetalen of kies je een andere optie?
* NS Business card of een reiskostenvergoeding.
* Hybride werken is bij ons heel normaal. Om dat te faciliteren bieden wij je een goede thuiswerkvergoeding en een thuiswerkplek.
* Een goede pensioenregeling, wij vinden het belangrijk dat je later ook nog profijt hebt van je inzet bij ons.



**Heb je vragen over deze vacature?**
=====================================


Neem dan contact op met Arsalan Seidony, Recruiter via of arsalan.seidony@stater.nl.

  

  

Acquisitie naar aanleiding van deze vacature wordt niet op prijs gesteld.
 Contact
**Gerelateerde vacatures**
==========================


### **Application Consultant AAH**


Technology
Als Applicatie Consultant maak je, namens Stater, onderdeel uit van een Business Development team van de grootste klant van Stater, ABN Amro Hypothek…


Amersfoort Fulltime €45.000 - €75.000
Solliciteer
### **Senior Sybase Database Administrator**


Technology
Jij hebt grote interesse in automatisering en bent nieuwsgierig naar nieuwe technieken. Je hebt al meerdere jaren ervaring als Sybase Database Admini…


Amersfoort Fulltime €45.000 - €75.000
Solliciteer

title: Data Engineer Planning and Release Management (Amersfoort)
description:
Data Engineer Planning and Release Management (Amersfoort)**In het kort**
---------------


ABN AMRO - Detecting Financial Crime

  

De wereld verandert snel en onze rol als gatekeeper verandert mee. Vanuit onze purpose ˜Banking for better, for generations to come' zetten we ons in voor een duurzaam, stabiel en veilig financieel systeem. Het opsporen van Financial Crime(DFC) staat bij ons dan ook hoog op de agenda. Daarmee vertellen we jou niets nieuws, want je bent maatschappelijk betrokken, integer en innovatief. Je wilt het juiste voor de klant, de maatschappij en de bank.


Binnen Detecting Financial Crime (DFC) hebben we alle activiteiten rond het opsporen van financie criminaliteit samengebracht. De voortschrijdende technologie is zowel een kans als een bedreiging. Niet alleen kunnen wij hierdoor ons opsporingswerk verbeteren, ook maakt het de georganiseerde misdaad steeds geavanceerder. Detecting financial crime is een ongoing process dat dag in dag uit het uiterste vraagt van onze expertise en alertheid.

**Je werk**
-----------


Als Data Specialist bij Planning & Release Management Change werk je aan de kwaliteit, betrouwbaarheid, (software-)ontwikkeling en opschaling van de P&RM (data-)producten. Je bent data-gedreven, resultaat-, oplossings- en klantgericht en je kunt business context naar IT oplossingen vertalen. Je bent een team player, deelt proactief kennis binnen het team en challenget P&RM collega's om het team verder te brengen.

**Werkomgeving**
----------------


Planning & Release Management Change kent 4 focusgebieden: Back-End, Populatie, Prioritering en Release. Jij bent met name actief binnen het focusgebied Prioritering. In dit focusgebied wordt het volgende van je verwacht:

* Het in PySpark verder ontwikkelen en optimaliseren van de betrouwbaarheid en performance van de automatische Prioritering flow en de flow forecast van dossiers en analistenteams.
* Het onderhouden en verder ontwikkelen van de Power BI front-end die bij deze producten hoort.
* Ook ben je binnen dit focusgebied regelmatig vliegende keep voor de verdere ontwikkeling van Populatie- en Release-vraagstukken.
* Verantwoordelijkheid voor grotere werkpakketten en epics; uitplannen, prioriteren en (mede) uitvoeren van ontwikkelwerk.
* Goede onderlinge communicatie & samenwerking met collega's binnen en buiten jouw focusgebied.
**Je profiel**
--------------

* Afgeronde kwantitatieve HBO of WO-opleiding;
* Sterk analytisch & data-gedreven mindset;
* 1 tot 3 jaar ontwikkelervaring in Python (PySpark) en/of R;
* Cloud-ervaring (Databricks) is een pré;
* Affiniteit met Advanced Analytics is een pré;
* Ervaring met Agile Scrum werken;
* Communicatief vaardig in Nederlands & Engels;
**Wij bieden**
--------------

* Het bovenaan de pagina weergegeven bruto maandsalaris is op basis van een 36-urige werkweek, inclusief vakantiegeld en benefit budget.
* Het benefit budget bedraagt 11% van je salaris. Als je in een maand geen aankopen of reserveringen doet in de Benefit Shop, krijg je over die maand een twaalfde deel van jebenefit budget uitbetaald.
* Vijf weken vakantie per jaar. Je hebt de mogelijkheid om vier weken per jaar bij te kopen.
* Persoonlijk Ontwikkelbudget van € 1.000,- per jaar. Dit bedrag kun je opsparen tot € 3.000,-.
* Mogelijkheid tot thuiswerken (in overleg met je team en afhankelijk van je functie).
* Een ov-jaarabonnement met gratis openbaar vervoer in heel Nederland
* Een uitstekende pensioenregeling.
**Interesse?**
--------------


Ben je geinteresseerd? Reageer dan nu op deze vacature. We maken graag kennis met je.

**Gelijke kansen voor iedereen**
--------------------------------


Het succes van onze organisatie staat of valt met de kwaliteit van onze mensen en de ideeen die zij hebben. Echt verrassende inzichten en innovatieve oplossingen voor onze klanten ontstaan door een samenspel van culturen, kennis en ervaring. Daarom is diversiteit voor onze organisatie ontzettend belangrijk. Om ervoor te zorgen dat alle collega's binnen ABN AMRO hun kwaliteiten kunnen ontplooien, stimuleren we een inclusieve cultuur waarin iedereen zich betrokken en gewaardeerd voelt.

**Disclaimer externe recruitmentbureaus**
-----------------------------------------


Externe recruitmentbureaus dienen een overeenkomst met ABN AMRO BANK N.V. te hebben getekend, uitgegeven door een Talent Acquisition Specialist, om cv's te mogen indienen. Acquisitie wordt daarom niet op prijs gesteld.

### **Wij vragen**

* Samenwerkingsgerichtheid

### **Wij bieden**

* Analytische skills
company_description: Bij ABN AMRO hebben we een duidelijke purpose: Banking for better, for generations to come. Samen met onze klanten gaan we de uitdagingen van onze tijd aan en geven we vorm aan de toekomst.

title: Marketing Operations Data Intern
description:
Bynder goes far beyond managing digital assets. Our digital asset management platform enables teams to conquer the chaos of proliferating content, touchpoints, and relationships in order to thrive.

  



With powerful and intuitive solutions that embrace the way people want to work, and a richly integrated ecosystem, We are the brand ally that unifies and transforms the creation and sharing of assets, inspiring teams, delighting customers, and elevating businesses.

  



Our 500+ employees, known as 'Byndies', together constitute the world's most extensive pool of digital asset management expertise. We enable more than 1.7M users across more than 3,700 organizations, including Spotify, Puma, Five Guys and Icelandair.

  

Founded in 2013, we have eight offices around the globe, including the Netherlands, USA, Spain, UK, Australia and UAE. For more information, visit www.bynder.com.

**About the role:**



As Marketing Operations Data Intern you will be part of the Bynder Revenue Operations team. Which is responsible for helping the Marketing, Sales and Customer Success teams achieve their goals & targets. Their purpose is to increase efficiency, effectiveness, and business contribution by aligning revenue impacting teams. The team focuses on both strategic and tactical projects relating to Forecasting, Data Analysis, Process Design, Technology, and Data Governance.



As a Data Intern within the Marketing Operations team you will help set up and maintain the marketing data landscape. This involves data documentation, data cleaning & visualization and enabling marketers to use our BI tool for data analysis.


**What you will do:**


* Data Analysis
* Data normalization
* Support marketers with their day-to-day data needs
* Assist with the administration of multiple marketing tools
* Help out with ad-hoc projects to improve marketing processes
* Develop the framework to solve challenges


**What you have:**


* You need to be available for a 6 month long full-time internship from ±August/September 2024.
* You currently follow an education in a related field (Business, Marketing, Data Analytics, etc.)
* You are not afraid to work with numbers
* Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Excel and Word
* Knowledge of a BI tool (Sisense, ThoughtSpot, Tableau or similar) is a plus
* Knowledge of a data programming language (Python, R, Matlab) is a plus
* You need to be fluent in English
* You need to be enrolled in a school/university throughout the whole duration of the internship


**Nice to haves:**


* You have a self starter mentality
* You need to have top-notch communication skills in speaking and in writing
* You have a strategic mindset, and you're eager to learn


**Why you'll love Bynder!**



At Bynder, innovation is in our DNA. We've worked hard to build an environment that promotes creative thinking and self-initiative within a culture of fun. It's common to find colleagues hanging out after work - if you believe in "be nice, work hard, have fun", you'll have an office full of friends.


**What we offer:**


* Work experience on a global level
* Paid internship
* The chance to be part of a young and ambitious team
* On-the-job training
* Personal development
* A broad scope of responsibilities
* Free lunch available every day


**Our commitment:**



Bynder Love is the principle that guides the way we grow our teams, support our employees, and celebrate our differences. At Bynder we strive to create a culture that embraces every Byndie because differences in background, experience, and perspective make Bynder even better. At Bynder a diverse, inclusive, and equitable workplace is one where all employees, whatever their ethnicity, color, sex, age, religion, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or physical and mental ability are valued and respected. Our commitment is for all Byndies to have the freedom to be their true authentic selves.



Just as we are never finished innovating, Bynder's commitment to being An Even Better Bynder is a constant, evolving commitment that includes education, listening, and action.

title: Senior Data Analyst, Engineering Security
description:
**About the Job:**  

Engineering Security (EngSec) at Uber is tasked with the cyber-defense of Uber's businesses and assets, and is on a major growth path to deliver the best capabilities for our businesses while advancing the cybersecurity field.
  

  

We are looking for a Data Analyst, to join the Data Analytics team, to develop processes and techniques for driving operational and business insight from the entire span of cybersecurity
  

programs, operations, and projects. This is a great opportunity to join a fast growing EngSec organization in a growth company focused on big bets, and to make a tremendous impact in driving metrics and data rigor in one of Tech's most exciting cybersecurity arenas.
  

  

**What you'll do:*** Develop an in-depth understanding of Engineering Security's rhythm of business and share strategic insights with senior leadership to influence decision making
* Design, develop, and maintain data pipelines and complex queries using Python and SQL to ensure the accuracy and availability of data
* Build executive-level dashboards on Tableau to facilitate real-time data-driven decision-making and provide actionable insights
* Build and deploy statistical and machine learning models for a range of applications in the Engineering Security space
* Develop executive-level communications and presentations, translating complex data analysis into clear, concise, and impactful insights for Uber's senior leadership team.

**Basic Qualifications:*** Undergraduate and/or graduate degree in math, statistics, computer science, engineering or other quantitative fields (or equivalent work experience)
* 4+ years of experience as a data analyst
* Strong proficiency in Python and SQL
* Extensive experience with Tableau or similar data visualization tools
* Strong understanding of statistical analysis and machine learning techniques, with a proven track record of deploying models
* Experience with ML Ops frameworks such as MLflow, Google Vertex AI, or similar.
* Exposure to cloud technologies such as AWS, GCP, or Azure.

**Preferred Qualifications:*** Experience implementing LLMs or similar models into data analysis use cases
* Knowledge of additional programming languages such as R or Java
company_description: We reimagine the way the world moves for the better.

title: Visual Designer
description:
About Us:


Would you like to make a positive impact on the world? Do you want to be part of an exciting, fast-growing international scale-up? If the answer is yes, you have come to the right place because we are looking for a talented Visual Designer to join the Talk360 team!


Your Role:


As a Visual Designer at Talk360, you will play a crucial role in visually communicating our brand's purpose, values, and messaging. You'll be part of a purpose-driven startup, creating designs that drive growth and success. You will help build and maintain a consistent brand identity across all communication channels.  



  

**What will you do?**


* Take end-to-end responsibility for the visualization of Talk360; app UI/UX, website design, socials, brand assets and designs for digital & offline marketing.
* Work within a cutting-edge growth marketing team and develop visuals for marketing and advertising that reach millions of people.
* Create and deliver compelling visuals on brand, on time and within budget.
* Collaborate with our product/development teams to enhance the app experience; design UI elements, in-app UX flows and brand-new app features.
* Stay up to date on the latest design practices, AI and tools to develop new visual experiments.
* Be a key communication stakeholder within the organisation and elevate the look and feel of the Talk360 brand.
Build and expand a network of freelancers and agencies to potentially outsource and prioritise design work and projects.  

* 
  

  

  

  

**Who are you?**


* Strong foundation in design principles; typography, color theory, alignment etc. Ability to conceptualize and translate ideas into visually appealing designs.
* Several years of graphic design experience ideally at a software / tech scale up.
* Able to quickly iterate and experiment with designs based on direct feedback from analytical marketing and product data.
* Excellent communication skills to work effectively with a diverse team and stakeholders.
* Proficiency in Graphic Design Tools: Expertise in Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign, AfterEffects), Figma or equivalent tools.
* Purpose driven; we are a calling app focussed on helping African Migrants stay in touch with their friends and family.
* You work organised and can organise a large library of design assets
* Able to manage multiple design projects simultaneously while maintaining attention to detail and deadlines.
* Affinity with the African region or speaking African languages is considered a plus.
Being able to leverage AI to enhance your creative workflows and output is a plus.  

* 
  

**Perks & Benefits:**


* Growth and learning opportunities in a high-growth environment.
* Personal development budget, also for non-job-related opportunities.
* Company laptop.
* Monthly phone allowance.
* 25 vacation days annually.
* Commute allowance.
* Weekly Thursday lunches, with more gatherings in between.
* Loads of autonomy.
* Work with a diverse & multicultural team - we have Talketeers all over the world, such as Suriname, Turkey, Estonia, Egypt, Kenya, Nigeria, South Africa, and the Netherlands.
**Ready to Apply?**


Does this sound like the role you've been looking for and would you like to be part of our journey? Then make sure to get in touch today because we can’t wait to meet you!

title: Senior Data Analyst
description:
**Introduction to the job**
---------------------------


If you join the Business Intelligence & Analytics team, you become part of ASML’s largest department: Development & Engineering. Here you will get a front-row seat of our company’s key process: where the sharpest minds in hardware and software, design and develop some of the world’s most complex machines.


Our mission is to work with experts in our organization and use data to create value for ASML and its customers. We do this by participating in large transformation programs that bring change throughout ASML, and by working directly with teams and colleagues in the organization to unlock new insights and develop effective data-driven solutions that solve specific problems and drive continuous improvement. We work closely with our partners in IT to ensure our algorithms, dashboards and applications are deployed in a sustainable manner and supported to secure availability.


With the demand for chips continuously growing, our customers challenge us to deliver more advanced lithography solutions at higher speeds and quality. We consider data a key enabler in facing this challenge and are excited about the impact we can make by leveraging our data, analytics and visualization skills. For example, by predicting the amount of parts to keep in stock, by developing an enterprise dashboard that delivers consistent performance insights on all levels of the organization, or by analyzing unstructured data for opportunities to improve cycle time of specific processes.

**Role and Responsibilities**
-----------------------------

* Talk with experts in our organization to understand the business problems they face. In addition brainstorm with your colleagues to see how data can be used to solve these problems
* Perform exploratory data analysis to identify trends and patterns that can sharpen the challenge and use all tools available and determine the best solution, from descriptive to prescriptive insights
* Get into the ‘dirt’ by cleaning and preparing data for processing, statistical analysis and modelling. Furthermore you will provide quick fact-based answers and insights to ad hoc questions during transformation prototyping
* Transform data to insights by applying different techniques using your craftsmanship. Next to that you will also formulate hypotheses based on business process understanding and test using business process data
* Challenge business assumptions using fact-based analyses and quick prototypes to convince stakeholders
* Directly manage stakeholders of your analysis by involving them on developments in your work. Moreover, use business knowledge and prior experiences to challenge data analysis requests and approaches
* Think outside boundaries of your job description in order to support the quality of your deliverable. And have fun with your colleagues, dare to disrupt, find the best solution and make it ‘stick’

**Education and experience**
----------------------------


Bachelor or Master degree  

At least 4 years of practical experience

 **Skills**

Working at the cutting edge of tech, you’ll always have new challenges and new problems to solve – and working together is the only way to do that. You won’t work in a silo. Instead, you’ll be part of a creative, dynamic work environment where you’ll collaborate with supportive colleagues. There is always space for creative and unique points of view. You’ll have the flexibility and trust to choose how best to tackle tasks and solve problems. To thrive in this job, you’ll need the following skills:

* Fluent in Python and R or SQL
* Knowledge of data cleaning, modelling and transformation
* Fluent in English both verbally and written
* Excellent in math, statistics and data visualization

**Other information**

title: Data Business Analyst Supply Chain
description:
It's fun to work in a company where people truly BELIEVE in what they are doing!*We're committed to bringing passion and customer focus to the business.*
The Opportunity:
As a Senior Data Business Analyst, you will be responsible for driving data-driven decision making and strategic insights to support the agriculture supply chain operations of our client. Leveraging your extensive experience in the agriculture domain and expertise in sustainability and compliance initiatives, you will work closely with cross-functional teams to identify, analyze, and interpret complex data sets to uncover opportunities for optimization, cost savings, and improved sustainability.
We are seeking a dedicated Supply chain Sustainability & ESG Subject Matter Expert (SME) with a profound understanding of ESG, EUDR and sustainability factors, particularly within Supply Chain. Understand the risks, opportunities, & consult client on data gaps & data sources.
The ideal candidate will possess expertise in compliance requirements for major regulations across the globe relevant to ESG like European Union Deforestation, Extended Producer Responsibility & GHG Emissions Reporting.
Key Responsibilities* Understand the client business requirements/ problem statements with limited information, come up with comprehensive solution approach with necessary assumptions.
* Setup & drive discovery sessions with client team to understand ESG & EUDR digitalization project requirements, As is Process, Success criteria, challenges & bottle necks mapping.
* Collaborate with business stakeholders to understand their data and analytics requirements, and translate them into technical solutions using the Cloudera Hadoop ecosystem
* Perform exploratory data analysis to identify trends, patterns, and insights that drive strategic decision-making in the agriculture supply chain
* Clearly communicate insights and technical approaches to clients verbally and in writing, including documenting analytical methodologies for reports and developing graphs, charts, and other outputs appropriate for use by senior executives.
* Collaborate cross-functionally to integrate supply chain sustainability considerations into business strategies and operations.
* Describe the recording of the source data, including a summary of the person/system that collects and records initial data.
* Describe the aggregation of the source data, including a summary of how information generated from multiple data sources is aggregated to complete a single KPI metric.
* Consult clients on calculations performed on the source data, or to estimate data, including a summary of the processes necessary to transform data into a series of inputs utilized within the final KPI metric calculation and inventory.
* Conceptualise cohesive ESG/EUDR data architecture.
* Develop systematic rules for collecting and processing EUDR raw data.
* Support clients in aligning their reporting practices with international and sector-specific frameworks such as EUDR, CDP, and the SDGs.


Required Qualifications:* 8+ years of experience as a Business Data Analyst or Senior Data Analyst in the sustainable supply chain, ESG domain
* B.Tech, or MBA, Good to have a degree in related discipline preferred such as Climate Change, Sustainability, Business, or Environmental Engineering.
* Strong quantitative and qualitative analytical skills.
* Past exposure to CPG, Agro-based Industry or related will be an advantage.
* Exposure to working on ERP systems viz, SAP ECC, TMS, IBP, etc.
* Strong understanding of data modeling, ETL, SQL and data warehousing concepts
* Proficient in Python, SQL, and data visualization tools (Tableau, Power BI, etc.)
* Familiarity with EUDR, EPR, GRI, SASB, and other market standards and guidelines.
* Experience managing and coaching individuals/teams.
* Strong work ethic and eagerness to learn in a constantly evolving and fast-paced environment.
* A genuine team player who can reach objectives individually, as well as through close collaboration and coordination with other team members.


If you like wild growth and working with happy, enthusiastic over-achievers, you'll enjoy your career with us!
Not the right fit? Let us know you're interested in a future opportunity by clicking *Introduce Yourself* in the top-right corner of the page or create an account to set up email alerts as new job postings become available that meet your interest!

title: Business Analyst Analytics
description:
A
Posted by
Alexander Mungkorn
Recruiter


For a client based in Amsterdam, we are looking for a Business Analyst in Analytics to join the Benelux business insights team. Focused on the marketing, segment you engage with senior leadership and work across teams with marketeers, financial analysts, business and product developers to drive strategy and business planning. Based on data analysis, you deliver insights to your stakeholders.


| Responsibilities |


* Analyze data to get insights on trends, anomalies and opportunities and drive business decisions


* Drive marketing campaigns both in set up (strategy, selections, experimentation design) and evaluation.


* Gather market insights and translate them into impactful initiatives for our business teams


* Set-up, automate, maintain, and own dashboards and reporting structure for operational metrics and revenue streams of your focus area


* Use advanced modeling to gain understanding of the drivers of customer behavior


* Closely work together with the marketing teams and finance teams to define the key operational and financial metrics


* Construct and deliver clear, concise presentations of findings, key product and user performance metrics and management recommendations both in oral and written form


| Requirements |


Academic degree, preferably in a quantitative field like mathematics, econometrics, statistics etc.


* Very strong analytical, reporting and visualization skills


* Advanced SQL and Excel skills are a requirement. Experience with R, Python or similar is a plus

* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills; proven ability to successfully work and partner across multiple functions in an organization


* The skill to explain complicated analyses in a simple way to colleagues and management


* Experienced in Marketing Analytics


* Ability to work in an agile and flexible environment where change is part of the day-to-day environment


* The attitude to go that extra mile when needed and celebrate success after achievements

  



| Job Details |


Start Date: ASAP


Full Time: 32-40 hours/week


Duration: 1 Year


Location: Amsterdam (Hybrid)


For inquiries, contact Alexander Mungkorn, Delivery Consultant, at alexander.mungkorn@mbanl.com.

title: Data Engineer
description:
### **About Us:**


Paebbl is a founder-led start up in the emerging field of climate technology and the new “carbon economy”. Our mission is to permanently sequester CO2 and repurpose it into products that the world needs. Inspired by natural CO2 mineralization, our technology accelerates this process by a factor of a million and is now ready for scale-up. We are privately financed by supportive, long-term oriented institutional and private investors, and our diverse team includes experts from technology, industrial engineering, digital innovation, waste management, finance, and academia.

### **Overview**


Join our team at Paebbl as a Data Engineer and take a central role in developing cutting-edge digital systems essential for our innovation and growth. This position involves providing technical leadership to acquire, process, and make our data accessible to ensure that our digital platforms help us deliver market leading products consistently. You will lead significant projects to contextualise our data, and make it accessible and useful for strategic decision-making and technology development across the organization. The role is perfect for a dynamic professional with a strong background in handling a broad range of data types, especially scientific and IoT data, who is adept at navigating start-up-like environments and making autonomous decisions. As a leader, you will also drive the growth of new capabilities and provide supervision for our expanding team, shaping the future of Paebbl’s data infrastructure on our greenfield platform

### **Required Skills and Qualifications:**

* Strong proficiency in data architecture, software engineering (ideally with Python), and cloud engineering.
* Strong proficiency in data engineering, including data visualization and IoT data handling (ideally on AWS).
* Good communication and presentation skills, with the ability to articulate complex technical details to non-technical stakeholders.
* Demonstrated leadership in technical project management, agile working, and strategic decision-making.
* Experience with data science, simulation, machine learning, and handling unstructured data is highly desirable.
* Ideally 3 years experience in business or industrial settings

### **Key Responsibilities:**

* Lead the iterative design and implementation of a data platform to support the needs of critical business projects.
* Develop and manage cloud-based systems to ensure scalable and efficient data processing and storage.
* Utilize advanced data engineering techniques to handle both structured and unstructured data.
* Collaborate with data scientists, modellers, platform, and software engineers to create integrated solutions that drive knowledge-driven decision making.
* Provide technical supervision for new data engineers, which is seen as a key capability in the fast-growing digital team
* Drive the adoption of best practices in data security, data quality, and data governance.

### **What We Offer:**

* Market-rate salary.
* Stock option program participation.
* Private healthcare insurance.
* Annual training and development budget.
* Annual wellness budget.
* 25 days of paid vacation.
* Up to 6 months of compensated parental leave.
* Standard pension scheme support.
* Remote first digital team, based across Europe.


We believe in fostering a constructive, inclusive work environment that respects all stakeholders, including our team, collaborators, customers, and partners. Our Code of Conduct reflects our commitment to cultivating a positive workplace culture. Join us and be part of a pioneering company shaping the future of CO2 removal and CO2-negative materials industries. Ready to make a real impact? Apply today and help us shape a sustainable future!

title: Data Analyst
description:
**Our employees talk trash all day, every day.**

**That’s why we love them!**

Orbisk employees **do** talk trash a lot. To be more precise, they discuss reducing food waste in the hospitality industry. How does the Orbi work in practice? Waiters scan cleared plates at Orbisk hardware stations, and our algorithms throw themselves on the leftovers to determine when ingredients were thrown away and in what quantity. Food for (actionable) thought because if we – for example – discover that guests aren’t into tomatoes but devour every last spec of avocado, restaurateurs can source smarter, reducing food waste and costs. We’ve already helped eliminate a whopping 737.520 kg of food waste, and we’re just getting started!

**As our Data Analyst,** you'll step into the role of our groundbreaking 'data detective' - the nickname we made up for the analyst who transforms complex data into clear, actionable insights for our product. Partnering with our Data & AI team, you will be responsible for transforming complex data sets into user-friendly insights that drive strategic decision-making and operational efficiency.

Additionally, we invite you to use your expertise to improve our data usability and enhance overall data quality. We want Orbisk to become a well-known name in the global hospitality business, and we believe you can help us achieve that goal.

**Our Product: The Orbisk Dashboard**  
Our product is a data-rich dashboard that shows all the waste registered by one or multiple of our Orbi’s. We can slice and dice this data in many different ways. As you can imagine, one Orbi registering waste is quite straightforward, but as we grow we now face the challenge of customers with increasingly complex environments, like waste from more than 200 different Orbis in different locations, time-zones, currencies and other (cultural) differences.

In this role, you'll become an expert in the data collected by the Orbi food waste monitor. You will frequently participate in food waste coaching sessions with our customers, assisting the Orbisk coaches in understanding customer data to maximize the value we can extract for them. Besides addressing hands-on data requests, you will also be responsible for systematically identifying common patterns in how customers successfully utilize the provided data. You will then translate these insights into new features that enhance our product's effectiveness. Do you feel like you are ready to bite down into this great international data challenge?

**The role in 6 bullets**

* Analyze data from multiple Orbi's to identify trends, patterns, and opportunities for waste reduction.
* Develop and maintain intuitive, data-rich dashboards that provide clear insights into food waste metrics.
* Work closely with our product owner, developers, and other stakeholders to implement data-driven solutions.
* Continuously seek ways to improve data collection, analysis processes, and reporting accuracy.
* Conduct user research to understand the needs and behaviors of our clients, ensuring our data solutions are aligned with their goals.
* Propose and implement innovative data analysis methodologies and tools to enhance our service offerings.

**Your track record mentions**

* You've been in the data game for 3+ years.
* Masters or bachelors degree in a technical field, such as data science or computer science.
* The magic, or ability to convert questions or requirements into comprehensive data reports, dashboards, or other data solutions.
* Thorough and meticulous approach to understanding data nuances, complexities, and the necessity for accurate reporting.
* You're a "masterchef" when it comes to data analysis frameworks and tools such as SQL, Python, dashboarding solutions, and data visualization.
* Big plus: experience with data-heavy products, where extracting value from data requires innovation beyond standard reporting and dashboarding.

**Why join Orbisk?**

For a whole menu of reasons. Some lofty (reducing food waste also reduces our collective CO2 and H2O footprints), others more down-to-earth. After all, joining a scale-up that disrupts an entire industry is also just plain fun. And a great conversation starter. Especially if that team is as driven and adventurous as ours. We also offer you:

* €4.500 - €6.000 gross p/m (depending on knowledge and experience)
* Pension scheme and 30 paid vacation days (based on 40 hours per week)
* Company laptop and €250 netto home office budget per year
* Education & Alleo budget, and a travel allowance
* Free office lunch and an office dog to keep you company
* An office based in Utrecht and option to work partly remote
* A young and creative startup work environment that invests in your development
* A close-knit team with smart, enthusiastic colleagues who are happy to share their expertise with you. And on Fridays, a (non-alcoholic?) beer or two.

**Get to know us**

We can’t wait to tell you more about our plans. Reach out by clicking on that apply button or contact Doğu Colak via Whatsapp +31 6 38711496.

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time, Permanent

Pay: €4.500,00 - €6.000,00 per month

Expected hours: 32 – 40 per week

Language:

* Engels (Required)

Work authorization:

* Nederland (Required)

Work Location: Hybrid remote in Utrecht

title: Data Scientist
description:
**Date:** Jul 4, 2024


**Location:** Amsterdam, NL


**Company:** AkzoNobel


**About AkzoNobel**


Since 1792, we’ve been supplying the innovative paints and coatings that help to color people’s lives and protect what matters most. Our world class portfolio of brands – including Dulux, International, Sikkens and Interpon – is trusted by customers around the globe. We’re active in more than 150 countries and use our expertise to sustain and enhance the fabric of everyday life. Because we believe every surface is an opportunity. It’s what you’d expect from a pioneering and long-established paints company that’s dedicated to providing sustainable solutions and preserving the best of what we have today – while creating an even better tomorrow. Let’s paint the future together.

  


For more information please visit www.akzonobel.com

  


© 2024 Akzo Nobel N.V. All rights reserved.


**Let's paint a picture of the role**
-------------------------------------

The Data Scientist supports Internal Audit in its strategy to transform into a data driven function and reports into to Senior Audit manager in charge of Data & Analytics. The data scientist enables value-added insights via development and execution of data analytics and data visualizations to support the global internal audit function.  

  

The Data Scientist role is expected to also join some audits as auditor, to experience how audits are performed and to help identifying improvement areas in utilizing data.  



**Responsibilities**
--------------------


* Supports internal audit in identifying risk areas, planning, audits and review of controls testing using different Data Analytical tools and techniques;
* Translates requirements from Internal audit in obtaining an understanding of business data and translate into useable analytics/insights;
* Obtains the necessary data (and tools) to identify, design and develop insights;
* Designs and develops advanced risk analytics to support (annual) audit plan;
* Provide central, independent, common and easy access to key data for audit work;
* Building strong relationships with stakeholders to support our data access and analytical capability to meet current and future requirements.
* Supports the wider development and deployment of Data Analysis skills and competencies within AkzoNobel Internal Audit Function;
* Provide internal audit staff training in use of data analytics tools / developments / techniques;
* Update audit staff on new developments.
**What do you need to have to be successful in this role?**
-----------------------------------------------------------



Education  

Bachelor or master’s degree preferably in computer science, information technology, artificial intelligence, accounting, auditing, economic or business administration. Experience in audit profession is preferred.  

  

Experience


* At least 5 years of data analytics experience ideally with experience in public accounting and/or in a large internal audit function and/or large or mid-sized international manufacturing company;
* Understand various data structures and common methods in data transformation and excellent pattern recognition and predictive modeling skills;
* Experience with data processing, database programming, data analytics and visualization tools (such as… ETL, SQL, Alteryx, IDEA, MS Power BI, Celonis, Databricks, MS Fabric…..).

  

  

Essential skills


* Professional skepticism, critical thinking, problem solving, analytic;
* Analytical mindset, at ease with numbers and structured;
* Sensitive to deadlines and budget constraints;
* Effective time management skills;
* Detail oriented;
* Experience and able to work with different cultures, management styles;
* Excellent communicator (presentation and communication skills);
**What does AkzoNobel offer in return?**
----------------------------------------


* Above average number of annual holidays: 46 days.
* Participation in the AkzoNobel pension plan.
* Fixed bonus (CLA).
* Travel expenses to and from work.
* Opportunities for ongoing education and professional development.
* Hybrid way of working.
* Being part of events and networking platforms.
* Paint with a discount.
**More information on how to apply?**
-------------------------------------

We welcome your online application via https://careers.akzonobel.com/.  

If you have questions about the role or interview process, please contact Merith de Bock at merith.debock@akzonobel.com.  

  

The recruitment process includes a selection of the best applications received through the system, interview rounds, and further steps. An online assessment and an employment screening are part of the selection process.



At AkzoNobel we are highly committed to ensuring an inclusive and respectful workplace where all employees can be their best self. We strive to embrace diversity in a context of tolerance. Our talent acquisition process plays an integral part in this journey, as setting the foundations for a diverse environment. For this reason we train and educate on the implications of our Unconscious Bias in order for our TA and hiring managers to be mindful of them and take corrective actions when applicable. In our organization, all qualified applicants receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age or disability.


Requisition ID: 41099

title: Analytics Manager Europe (m/f/d)
description:
BIRKENSTOCK is a global brand which embraces all consumers regardless of geography, gender, age and income. The company is deeply footed on a family tradition of shoemaking that can be traced back to 1774. With around 6200 employees worldwide, BIRKENSTOCK is the largest employer in the German footwear industry. To ensure our quality standards, we produce over 95% of our products in Germany and source more than 90% of our materials and components from Europe. The BIRKENSTOCK Group is headquartered in Linz am Rhein and maintains several locations in Germany, as well as sales offices in Europe, North America, the Middle East and Asia.  



Join us in shaping the future at our location in **Amsterdam** as an


**Analytics Manager Europe (m/f/d)**

  


YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES:


* Own the business analytics process by leveraging data and analytics to drive actionable insights, define new opportunities, and foster winning strategies to elevate our understanding and analytics strategy for our Customer Experiences
* Lead Business Trade (weekly, monthly, quarterly), with the key goal of supporting the business stakeholders in understanding past performance, to take actions and steer the business based on data and insights
* Create and own a new Performance Forecasting process, to support the business in understanding and predicting future performance, to best steer actions and projects to hit our functional goals, as well as best plan our logistics processes and shipping volumes, to run our business as efficiently as possible
* Gather and handle large data sets, run different analytics techniques and models on this data, identify insights and trends from the results of those analysis, present insights to your business stakeholders and leadership as actionable opportunities and useful learnings, follow up on those actions by measuring their impact and performance
* Create and manage reports and dashboards to both enable the business teams to run self-serve analysis and lead business trade
* Work closely with your analytics peers (Marketing analytics, Web analytics, and Consumer analytics) to ensure that the insights and analyses are translated into recommendations for our business stakeholders to drive actions for our consumers, and steer our business strategies
* Partner closely with several core functions within the D2C business - Leadership Team (for business trade and steering), Finance and Sales Planning (for forecasting and budgeting), Analytics (in Global and other territories such as US), Business Intelligence (in Global, for data creation, handling, and management)
* To bring insights to action, work also closely with: Onsite Experience (website UX, conversion optimisation, content engagement), Digital Product (platform health, new releases, AB testing, features improvements), Product & Merchandising (assortment planning, promotions, franchise lifecycle management), Retail (store performance, assortment, online-to-offline)

  




YOUR EXPERIENCE AND COMPETENCIES:


* University degree in business analytics, data science, statistics, or business management related courses
* 5+ years of professional experience in Data Science, Business Analytics, or Business Intelligence teams
* Experience in e-commerce, fashion and/or retail industry is a plus
* Previous experience or knowledge of budgeting and forecasting processes, business trade and reviews, analytics metrics and techniques, synthesis of insights and action-driven data projects
* Capacity to balance long-term projects and quick turn-around support, including key business timelines, to independently manage time and prioritisation of tasks for day-to-day work, being ready to adapt to changes in business priorities or strategy
* Strong verbal and written communication skills, including project management capacities
* Manage multiple stakeholders and leaders within same project and time
* Work independently and proactive to bring forward processes and projects, as well as bring together stakeholders and team members towards common goals
* Willingness to learn both new technical skills, as well as retail and e-commerce business dynamics and processes
* Motivated to work in a dynamic and international environment, fostering different point of views, cultures and diversity in the workplace
* Confident knowledge of Excel and PowerPoint / Keynote as well as Tableau or similar data visualization and analysis tools
* Confident SQL knowledge and familiarity with the handling of large datasets; Python or other advanced coding languages for modelling as well as Google or Adobe Analytics is a plus
* Fluent English language skills

  


WE OFFER:


BIRKENSTOCK offers you all the advantages of a successful, fast growing, global company: dynamic work environment, considerable design freedom, authentic and open corporate culture and excellent development opportunities. Sounds exciting? It is. Our Talent Acquisitoin team is looking forward to receiving your online application!

title: Senior Network Data Service Architect
description:
ABOUT US
We’re building Tomorrow’s Connections Today, bringing people together through the power of our technology.
Liberty Global is a world leader in converged broadband, video and mobile communications and an active investor in cutting-edge infrastructure, content and technology ventures.
With our investments in fibre-based and 5G networks we play a vital role in society, currently providing over 85 million fixed and mobile connections and rolling out the next generation of products and services, while readying our networks for 10 Gbps and beyond.
We’re creating national champions, combining the best broadband and mobile networks under brands such as Virgin Media-02 in the UK, VodafoneZiggo in The Netherlands, Telenet in Belgium, Sunrise in Switzerland, Virgin Media in Ireland and UPC in Slovakia.
Liberty Global Ventures, our global investment arm, has a portfolio of more than 75 companies and funds across content, technology and infrastructure, including strategic stakes in ITV, Univision, Plume, Lionsgate and the Formula E racing series.
Our scale enables us to transfer knowledge and expertise across our operations and investments, creating a dynamic family of brands united in the pursuit of innovation and excellence.
And we’re prioritising diversity, equity and inclusion in our workplace and communities, while reducing our impact on the environment. We are using technology as a force for good; for our people, our partners and the planet.
JOB PURPOSE
Liberty Global is seeking a highly skilled and experienced Network Service Data Architect to join our Fixed Network Domain team. The successful candidate will be responsible for the transformation of Liberty Global’s country organizations towards data-driven architectures using CLA/AI/ML applications for e.g. network self-healing, predictive maintenance or traffic utilisation optimisation to optimize CAPEX/ OPEX spend. This role requires a strategic problem solver with deep expertise in network technologies, data services and a passion for driving data-centric innovation.
KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES
Data Management and Integration:* Provide clear requirements for integrating and processing network telemetry data in existing or to be deployed data lakes from diverse network sources supporting various data models
* Provide requirements for data collection, processing, and storage that support AI/ML applications from the fixed network perspective.


Data Presentation:* Ensure telemetry data is accessible, consistent and usable across various platforms.
* Define and specify product data models to present network data in a user-friendly and actionable format.
* Provide requirements for data visualization to ensure effective decision-making processes.


Data Usage for AI/ML Applications:* Develop and define architectural requirements for integrating AI capabilities within data driven network architectures to ensure streamlined decision-making processes.
* Collaborate with AI/ML teams to leverage network data for developing predictive models and machine learning applications.
* Ensure data services (manage, process, and facilitate access to data) support the integration and usage of data in AI/ML workflows.
* Ensure AI/ML models can be effectively deployed and scaled within the network infrastructure.


Network Configuration:* Ensure AI/ ML applications provide required data points to efficiently trigger Network Controller or Service Orchestration platforms to configure network devices .


Security and Compliance:* Ensure all data services and data flows adhere to relevant data protection regulations and organizational policies.
* Implement and maintain comprehensive measures to improve network security .


Performance Optimization:* Continuously review and optimize the performance and scalability of data services to handle varying loads and ensure efficient operation.
* Enhance continuously data storage solutions and refine access patterns for improved efficiency and performance.


Collaboration and Support:* Work closely with Liberty Global’s country organizations to provide guidance, support, and expertise in their data-driven transformation efforts.
* Foster a culture of innovation by staying updated on industry trends and emerging technologies in data architecture and telecommunications.


KNOWLEDGE & EXPERIENCE
Essential skills & abilities:* Proven experience as a Data Architect or similar role, with a focus on transforming network operations through data-driven approaches.
* Deep understanding of network data, protocols, and technologies within the telecommunications industry, especially in the fixed network domain.
* Expertise in designing and developing APIs and data services.
* Good experience with data integration, ETL processes (Extract, Transform, Load), and data workflow design.
* Extensive knowledge of data security and compliance standards.
* Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to optimize data services for performance and scalability.
* Strong leadership, collaboration and communication skills.
* Experience with cloud-based data services and infrastructure is required.


Desirable skills & abilities:* Proficiency in data analytics and machine learning frameworks.
* Experience with big data technologies and tools.

title: CS Business Planning (Senior) Data Analyst
description:
**Introduction to the job**


ASML Customer Support (CS) is the face of ASML towards our customers. The CS organization consists of approximately ten thousand employees worldwide and is responsible for the full support of ASML’s customer activities in the field; such as installations, upgrades and relocations of tools as well as maintenance of them.


As the CS Business Planning department, we are the worldwide CS business partner for tactical and strategical headcount planning & decisions. We prepare and deliver resource requirement overviews, analyses and insights to support strategic decision making and operational review of business performance. The CS Business Planning department maintains the one source of truth for CS headcount budgets, and is the competence center for headcount planning methodologies.

**Role and responsibilities**

* Ensures Data Management and structures are in place to support and further improve Business Planning processes; provides data and supports in reporting to key stakeholders.
* Maintains and drives improvements in data structures, data maintenance and control. Drives standardization and automation of data flows.
* Secures operational availability of data and applications, acts as 1st line/2nd line support to business planners for the tooling within his/her responsibility -enabling continuity of critical business processes.
* Solves business questions through creation of data solutions, dashboards and data visualizations that enable leaders to make critical decisions. Links insights to actionable recommendations.
* Drives insight generation through comprehensive data analysis, enabling informed decision-making and strategic improvements.
* Develops, improves, and runs planning models to forecast, optimize, analyze headcount scenarios to support decision making with respect to different use-cases.

**Personal skills**

* Analytical skills with high attention to quality, consistency and accuracy
* High motivation and drive to achieve results
* Able to manage complexity, uncertainty
* Pro-active personality, taking initiative
* Excellent communication skills
* Has the drive for operational excellence / continuous improvement

**Education and experience**


MSc in Industrial Engineering, Computer Science, Econometrics, Mathematics, Information Management, Statistics or similar.


Experience

* 5+ years of relevant work experience as Data/Business Analyst, preferably in Planning domain.
* Good understanding of planning processes, Installed base management and service businesses.
* Expert in programming with Python.
* Expert in data analysis, reporting, performance measurement (developer in Spotfire, Power BI)
* Working with databases, setting up data structures.

**Context of the position**


The CS Business Planning department is key in delivering resource requirements and overviews to support monthly and annual budget processes. The department leads worldwide workforce planning and financial planning through maintaining and utilizing blueprints and norms within the headcount models it develops, and considering the dynamics within the demand and capability plans. The team guides its stakeholders with insights on impact of installed base growth, service contracts and UIR capabilities on the required workforce. In addition, insights are generated to improve performance on several metrics including costs and efficiency.


The Data Analyst will work closely with Business Planners that focus on combinations of Business Lines and customer support activities. The collaboration will take place within the regular planning processes as well as through continuous improvement initiatives/projects. The analyst will also collaborate with other analysts and data scientists within and outside CS to develop sustainable, aligned, end to end solutions to common challenges within the organization.


The Data Analyst will report to the Manager Data Management and Business Applications within CS Business Planning in Veldhoven.

*This position requires access to controlled technology, as defined in the Export Administration Regulations (15 C.F.R. § 730, et seq.). Qualified candidates must be legally authorized to access such controlled technology prior to beginning work. Business demands may require ASML to proceed with candidates who are immediately eligible to access controlled technology.*

**Diversity and inclusion**
---------------------------


ASML is an Equal Opportunity Employer that values and respects the importance of a diverse and inclusive workforce. It is the policy of the company to recruit, hire, train and promote persons in all job titles without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, or gender identity. We recognize that diversity and inclusion is a driving force in the success of our company.


Need to know more about applying for a job at ASML? Read our frequently asked questions.
